data.name: Togetic

attacks.name: Energy Present
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.

data.name: Solgaleo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sunsteel Strike
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sol Burst-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Latios-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Power Bind
abilities.text: If you have 4 or fewer Pokémon in play, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Tag Purge
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from TAG TEAM Pokémon.

attacks.name: Clear Vision-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your opponent can't use any GX attacks. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Porygon

attacks.name: Digicharge
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, search your deck for an Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon was created using the cutting-edge science of 20 years ago, so many parts of it have since become obsolete.

data.name: Steelix

attacks.name: Thumping Fall
attacks.text: Discard any number of Pokémon with a Retreat Cost of exactly 4 from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.

data.name: Lurantis

attacks.name: Petal Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sol Slice
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Fire Energy attached to it, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: For self-protection, it pretends to be a bug Pokémon. Both of its arms bear keen-edged petals.

data.name: Araquanid

abilities.name: Water Bubble
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Fire Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.

data.name: Lileep

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: In ancient times, it lived in warm seas. It disguised itself as seaweed to ambush its prey and devoured them whole when they got close.

data.name: Sealeo
data.flavorText: It has a very sensitive nose. It touches new things with its nose to examine them.

data.name: Alolan Meowth

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon was not originally found in Alola. Human actions caused a surge in their numbers, and they went feral. They're prideful and crafty.

data.name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Lakes where Dragonair live are filled with offerings from people, because they believe this Pokémon is able to control the weather.

data.name: Skarmory

attacks.name: Metallic Sound
attacks.text: Discard all Special Energy from each Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its feathers, which fall off as it grows, are thin and sharp. In times long past, warriors used them as swords.

data.name: Sharpedo

abilities.name: Greedy Evolution
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach any number of Darkness Energy cards you find there to this Pokémon. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Bad Fangs
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Darkness Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: People believe that carrying one of its discarded fangs will prevent mishaps at sea, so the fangs are made into accessories.

data.name: Celesteela-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Force Canceler
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, prevent all effects of your opponent's GX attacks, including damage, done to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Discovery-GX
attacks.text: Count your Prize cards and put them into your hand. Then, take that many cards from the top of your deck and put them face down as your Prize cards. If you don't have that many cards in your deck, this attack does nothing. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Yveltal

attacks.name: Blow Through
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Shadow Impact
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When this legendary Pokémon's wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.

data.name: Tornadus

attacks.name: Thunderous Tornado
attacks.text: If Thundurus is on your Bench, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.

data.name: Flareon

abilities.name: Power Cheer
abilities.text: The attacks of your Pokémon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Power Cheer Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If it inhales deeply, that's a sign it's about to attack. Prepare to be hit by flames of over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit!

data.name: Mimikyu

attacks.name: Impersonation
attacks.text: Discard a Supporter card from your hand. If you do, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Mischievous Hands
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon and put 2 damage counters on each of them.

data.flavorText: Although it's a quiet, lonely Pokémon, if you try to look at what's under its rag, it will become agitated and resist violently.

data.name: Aron

attacks.name: Rigidify
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.

data.name: Poison Barb
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Dedenne-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dedechange
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dedechange Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Tingly Return-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. Put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Roller Skater
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards. If you discarded an Energy card in this way, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Drowzee

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It can be spotted near recreational facilities, intending to eat the pleasant dreams of children who enjoyed themselves there that day.

data.name: Persian

abilities.name: Gathering of Cats
abilities.text: Ignore all Energy in the attack costs of each of your Pokémon in play that has the Caturday attack.

data.flavorText: Although the jewel on its forehead appears to be a different color than those of Alolan Persian, it's mostly made of the same material.

data.name: Archen

attacks.name: Endeavor
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Once thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon, some of the latest research suggests that may not be the case.

data.name: Lickitung

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It checks out whatever's around it by licking everything. If you don't clean off a spot where it's licked you, you'll break out in a rash!

data.name: Spearow
data.flavorText: Its reckless nature leads it to stand up to others—even large Pokémon—if it has to protect its territory.

data.name: Mewtwo

abilities.name: Mind Report
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may put a Supporter card from your discard pile on top of your deck.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA-engineering experiments.

data.name: Stakataka

abilities.name: Wall of Stone
abilities.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this Pokémon's maximum HP is 200.

attacks.name: Top Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.

data.name: Ribombee

abilities.name: Curative Pollen
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.

data.name: Umbreon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dark Call-GX
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Vikavolt

abilities.name: Strong Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Energy card and a Lightning Energy card and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Electro Cannon
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.

data.name: Audino

abilities.name: Hearing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Drain Slap
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.

data.name: Hau
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Carvanha

attacks.name: Gnaw Through
attacks.text: Discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If they scent the faintest trace of blood, they rush to attack en masse. When alone, they're rather cowardly.

data.name: Mega Sableye & Tyranitar-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Greedy Crush
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Gigafall-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 5 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard the top 15 cards of your opponent's deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Raichu

attacks.name: Electro Rain
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. Then, for each Energy you discarded in this way, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and do 30 damage to it. (You can choose the same Pokémon more than once.) This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: It focuses psychic energy into its tail and rides it like it's surfing. Another name for this Pokémon is "hodad."

data.name: Dratini

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It's still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies of water, eating whatever food sinks down and living a quiet life.

data.name: Purrloin

attacks.name: Cleaning Up
attacks.text: Discard a Pokémon Tool card from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.

data.name: Electromagnetic Radar
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Lightning Pokémon-GX and Lightning Pokémon-EX, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Sandygast

attacks.name: Shore Up
attacks.text: Attach a Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth. And so it adds to the accumulation of its sand-mound body.

data.name: Excadrill

attacks.name: Eleventh Hour Tackle
attacks.text: If there are 3 or fewer cards in your deck, this attack does 150 more damage.

attacks.name: Drill Bazooka
attacks.text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

data.flavorText: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

data.name: Mimikyu

abilities.name: Shadow Box
abilities.text: Pokémon-GX that have any damage counters on them (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.

attacks.name: Tail Trickery
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Although it's a quiet, lonely Pokémon, if you try to look at what's under its rag, it will become agitated and resist violently.

data.name: Togedemaru

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When it's surprised or agitated, the 14 fur spikes on its back will stand up involuntarily.

data.name: Gyarados-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam-GX
attacks.text: (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Beheeyem

attacks.name: Mysterious Noise
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck. Your opponent can't play any Item cards from their hand during their next turn.

data.flavorText: With its psychic powers, it rewrites its opponents' memories. You, too, may have already had your memories rewritten.

data.name: Seel
data.flavorText: It has always been supposed that Seel live only in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is a mystery.

data.name: Vileplume-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fragrant Flower Garden
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Massive Bloom
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Allergic Explosion-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Brionne

attacks.name: Disarming Voice
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards it enemies.

data.name: Litwick

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.

data.name: Solgaleo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sunsteel Strike
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sol Burst-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Slowpoke & Psyduck-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ditch and Splash
attacks.text: Discard any number of Supporter cards from your hand. This attack does 40 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Thrilling Times-GX
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 100 more damage. If this Pokémon has at least 6 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), flip 10 coins instead, and this attack does 100 more damage for each heads. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ultimate Ray
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Altered Creation-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), when your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from those attacks, take 1 more Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Riolu

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: It knows how people and Pokémon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn't approach dangerous opponents.

data.name: Meltan

attacks.name: Steel Melt
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Metal Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

data.name: Green's Exploration
rules: You can play this card only if you have no Pokémon with Abilities in play.
Search your deck for up to 2 Trainer cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Helioptile

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

data.name: Stunfisk

attacks.name: Trap Bolt
attacks.text: If, before doing damage, your opponent's Active Pokémon has more remaining HP than this Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.

data.name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Firestorm
attacks.text: Discard 3 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Overflowing with beauty and majesty, this strong Pokémon appears in ancient Eastern folklore.

data.name: Jessie & James
rules: Each player discards 2 cards from their hand. Your opponent discards first.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Cottonee

attacks.name: Dust Gathering
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body. When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows moist and heavy, and it can't move as well.

data.name: Black Kyurem

attacks.name: Frozen Wings
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dazzling Blizzard
attacks.text: If you have any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.flavorText: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

data.name: Keldeo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Pure Heart
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Resolute Blade-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Tapu Fini

attacks.name: Nature Wave
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Ultra Beasts in play, this attack can be used for Colorless.

data.flavorText: This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.

data.name: Litwick

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.

data.name: Blastoise & Piplup-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Splash Maker
attacks.text: You may attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. If you do, heal 50 damage from those Pokémon for each card you attached to them in this way.

attacks.name: Bubble Launcher-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 150 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cresselia

attacks.name: Aurora Gain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Luminous Blade
attacks.text: Discard a Psychic Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

data.name: Swirlix

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.

data.name: Zeraora

attacks.name: Crushing Claw
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they'll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.

data.name: Rainbow Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. While in play, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

data.name: Seaking

attacks.name: Enhanced Horn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads. If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, flip 6 coins instead.

data.flavorText: Its horn spins like a drill to steadily hollow out rocks—even harder ones. The coloration of the male is more vivid.

data.name: Flabébé

attacks.name: Floral Invitation
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fairy Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It's not safe without the power of a flower, but it will keep traveling around until it finds one with the color and shape it wants.

data.name: Ralts

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

data.name: Golduck

attacks.name: Energy Loop
attacks.text: Put an Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.flavorText: Even fast-swimming fish Pokémon can be disabled by Golduck. It brings them to a standstill and seizes them.

data.name: Darumaka

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

data.name: Martial Arts Dojo
rules: The attacks of non-Ultra Beast Pokémon that have any basic Fighting Energy attached to them (both yours and your opponent's) do 10 more damage to the opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If the attacking player has more Prize cards remaining than their opponent, those attacks do 40 more damage instead.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Naganadel-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Conversion
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard an Ultra Beast card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Venom Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Injection-GX
attacks.text: Add a card from your opponent's discard pile to their Prize cards face down. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Steelix

attacks.name: Thumping Fall
attacks.text: Discard any number of Pokémon with a Retreat Cost of exactly 4 from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.

data.name: Blue's Tactics
rules: At the end of this turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Welder
rules: Attach up to 2 Fire Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Dhelmise

attacks.name: Seaweed Grab
attacks.text: Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Buster Swing
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: It wraps its prey in green seaweed and sucks away their vitality. It only likes to go after big prey like Wailord.

data.name: Bounsweet

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.

data.name: Mr. Mime

attacks.name: Happy Mime
attacks.text: Each player draws a card.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Its pantomime skills are wonderful. You may become enraptured while watching it, but next thing you know, Mr. Mime has made a real wall.

data.name: Lillie
rules: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If it's your first turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Happiny

abilities.name: Playhouse Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.flavorText: Usually it's a well-behaved Pokémon, but if you take its round rock away, it will cry and fuss and throw a big old tantrum.

data.name: Dark City
rules: Basic Darkness Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Retreat Cost.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Pheromosa & Buzzwole-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jet Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Elegant Sole
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Elegant Sole attack's base damage is 60.

attacks.name: Beast Game-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card. If this Pokémon has at least 7 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 3 more Prize cards instead. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Latias

attacks.name: Energy Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to that Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: It communicates using telepathy. Its body is covered in down that refracts light to make it invisible.

data.name: Venusaur & Snivy-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shining Vine
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, when you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to it, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Solar Plant-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Stunfisk

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Electric Trap
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

data.flavorText: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.

data.name: Golisopod

abilities.name: Emergency Exit
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has 2 or fewer Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: First Impression
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: The shell covering its body is as hard as diamond. This Pokémon will do anything it takes to win.

data.name: Slaking

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dynamic Swing
attacks.text: You may do 100 more damage. If you do, during your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: The world's laziest Pokémon. It moves to another spot when there's no food left within its reach.

data.name: Krabby
data.flavorText: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

data.name: Komala

abilities.name: Drowsing
abilities.text: If this Pokémon remains Asleep between turns, put 6 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Snooze
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It stays asleep from the moment it's born. When it falls into a deep sleep, it stops moving altogether.

data.name: Blastoise-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rocket Splash
attacks.text: Shuffle any amount of Water Energy from your Pokémon into your deck. This attack does 60 damage for each card you shuffled into your deck in this way.

attacks.name: Giant Geyser-GX
attacks.text: Attach any number of Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Krookodile

attacks.name: Chomp Chomp Panic
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When it spots prey, even at a distance of over 30 miles, it swims through the desert as if it were water, then jumps out and chomps them.

data.name: Dusclops

attacks.name: Disable
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Anyone who dares peer into its body to see its spectral ball of fire will have their spirit stolen away.

data.name: Tyrogue

abilities.name: Bratty Kick
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.flavorText: It is always bursting with energy. To make itself stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.

data.name: Koffing

abilities.name: Blow-Away Bomb
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you discard this Pokémon with the effect of Roxie, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Place damage counters after the effect of Roxie.)

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.

data.name: Tapu Koko

attacks.name: Nature Dive
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Ultra Beast, this attack does 100 more damage, and discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Although it's called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.

data.name: Nosepass

attacks.name: Draw Toward
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It moves less than an inch a year, but when it's in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the ground in a split second.

data.name: Slakoth

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.

data.name: Magikarp
data.flavorText: In the distant past, they were fairly strong, but they have become gradually weaker over time.

data.name: Metapod
data.flavorText: Its shell is filled with a thick liquid. All of the cells throughout its body are being rebuilt in preparation for evolution.

data.name: Galvantula

attacks.name: Live Wire
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Also apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.

data.name: Giant Hearth
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a card from their hand. If they do, that player searches their deck for up to 2 Fire Energy cards, reveals them, and puts them into their hand. Then, that player shuffles their deck.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Oricorio-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dance of Tribute
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may draw 3 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dance of Tribute Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Strafe-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Zangoose

attacks.name: Brutal Edge
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It has feuded with Seviper for many generations. Its sharp claws are its biggest weapons.

data.name: Jangmo-o

attacks.name: Raging Claws
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It smacks the scales on its head against rocks or against the ground to frighten its opponents. It can also contact its friends with these noises.

data.name: Numel

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.

data.name: Lunala-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Psychic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Moongeist Beam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't be healed during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lunar Fall-GX
attacks.text: Knock Out 1 of your opponent's Basic Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Wynaut

abilities.name: Peppy Pick
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.flavorText: It tends to move in a pack with others. They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.

data.name: Lairon

attacks.name: Rigidify
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.

data.name: Draw Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
When you attach this card from your hand to a Pokémon, draw a card.

data.name: Porygon2

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.flavorText: AI has been installed in it. It learns various things all on its own, but it even remembers things it doesn't need to know.

data.name: Goldeen

attacks.name: Elegant Swim
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Although known for their splendid tail fins, Goldeen apparently compete among themselves to see whose horn is thickest and sharpest.

data.name: Slowbro

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Three Strikes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads. If all of them are tails, you lose this game.

data.flavorText: Spacing out is basically all it does. It turns back into Slowpoke if its tail, along with Shellder, breaks off.

data.name: Heatran-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Burning Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to become your Active Pokémon, you may move any number of Fire Energy from your other Pokémon to it.

attacks.name: Hot Burn-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Jangmo-o
data.flavorText: It smacks the scales on its head against rocks or against the ground to frighten its opponents. It can also contact its friends with these noises.

data.name: Butterfree
data.flavorText: Its wings are covered in toxic scales. If it finds bird Pokémon going after Caterpie, Butterfree sprinkles its scales on them to drive them off.

data.name: Toucannon

attacks.name: Echoed Voice
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Beak Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.

data.name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Destructive Whirlpool
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Lakes where Dragonair live are filled with offerings from people, because they believe this Pokémon is able to control the weather.

data.name: Triple Acceleration Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Evolution Pokémon. If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of the turn.
This card provides ColorlessColorlessColorless Energy only while it is attached to an Evolution Pokémon.
If this card is attached to anything other than an Evolution Pokémon, discard this card.

data.name: Vileplume-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fragrant Flower Garden
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Massive Bloom
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Allergic Explosion-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Coach Trainer
rules: Draw 2 cards. If your Active Pokémon is a TAG TEAM Pokémon, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lt. Surge's Strategy
rules: You can play this card only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent.
During this turn, you can play 3 Supporter cards (including this card).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Welder
rules: Attach up to 2 Fire Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Prinplup

attacks.name: Direct Dive
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.

data.name: Type: Null

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon weapon developed for a specific mission, it went berserk during an experiment, so it was cryogenically frozen.

data.name: Honchkrow

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It will absolutely not forgive failure from or betrayal by its goons. It has no choice in this if it wants to maintain the order of the flock.

data.name: Crobat

attacks.name: Triple Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Surprise Strike
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: Both its legs became wings, and as a result, it can't move well on the ground. All it can do is crawl around.

data.name: Reshiram & Zekrom-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fabled Flarebolts
attacks.text: Discard up to 3 in any combination of basic Fire and basic Lightning Energy cards from your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Cross Break-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If you played N's Resolve from your hand during this turn, this attack also does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's other Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Cottonee

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body. When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows moist and heavy, and it can't move as well.

data.name: Cynthia & Caitlin
rules: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand. You can't choose Cynthia & Caitlin or a card you discarded with the effect of this card.
When you play this card, you may discard another card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Shellder
data.flavorText: The hardness of its shell surpasses the hardness of a diamond. In days gone by, people used the shells to make shields.

data.name: Swadloon

abilities.name: Swaddling Leaves
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

data.name: Karrablast

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.

data.name: Sharpedo

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: It has a sad history. In the past, its dorsal fin was a treasured foodstuff, so this Pokémon became a victim of overfishing.

data.name: Venomoth

attacks.name: Assassin Flight
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition. This attack does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The scales it scatters will paralyze anyone who touches them, making that person unable to stand.

data.name: Xurkitree

attacks.name: Three Mirrors
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Signal Beam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

data.name: Dewpider
data.flavorText: When two Dewpider meet, they display their water bubbles to each other. Then the one with the smaller bubble gets out of the other's way.

data.name: Dewpider
data.flavorText: When two Dewpider meet, they display their water bubbles to each other. Then the one with the smaller bubble gets out of the other's way.

data.name: Professor Oak's Setup
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon of different types and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Porygon-Z

abilities.name: Crazy Code
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Special Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Its behavior is noticeably unstable, which is apparently due to the incompetence of the engineer who updated its programming.

data.name: Togedemaru

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.

data.name: Eevee

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: When you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon that is the same type as that Energy card and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

data.flavorText: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.

data.name: Eelektrik

attacks.name: Overspark
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.

data.name: Torkoal

attacks.name: Fire Fling
attacks.text: Put 4 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: You can tell how it's feeling by the smoke spouting from its shell. Tremendous velocity is a sign of good health.

data.name: Noibat

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Fruits are its favorite foods. This gourmet carefully picks out just the ripe ones using its sonar.

data.name: Mimikyu

attacks.name: Impersonation
attacks.text: Discard a Supporter card from your hand. If you do, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Mischievous Hands
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon and put 2 damage counters on each of them.

data.flavorText: Although it's a quiet, lonely Pokémon, if you try to look at what's under its rag, it will become agitated and resist violently.

data.name: Meowth

attacks.name: Caturday
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: When visiting a junkyard, you may catch sight of it having an intense fight with Murkrow over shiny objects.

data.name: Gastly

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It's said that gas emanating from a graveyard was possessed by the grievances of the deceased and thus became a Pokémon.

data.name: Cradily

abilities.name: Swaying Strangle
abilities.text: Your opponent's Pokémon that are affected by Special Conditions can't retreat.

attacks.name: Poison Tentacles
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Normally, it lived on shallow sea shoals. When the tide went out, this Pokémon came up on land to search for prey.

data.name: Lickitung

attacks.name: Heavy Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card for each of your Pokémon in play that has a Retreat Cost of exactly 4.

data.flavorText: It checks out whatever's around it by licking everything. If you don't clean off a spot where it's licked you, you'll break out in a rash!

data.name: Umbreon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dark Call-GX
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Brock's Training
rules: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Geodude, Graveler, Golem, Onix-GX, Cubone, Rhyhorn, Rhydon, or Sudowoodo.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Uxie

abilities.name: Secret Territory
abilities.text: If you have Mesprit and Azelf in play, apply Weakness for each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) as ×4 instead.

data.flavorText: Known as "The Being of Knowledge." It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

data.name: Giant Bomb
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your opponent's turn.

If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and takes 180 or more damage from an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 10 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Absol

attacks.name: Ominous News
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dirty Throw
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you can't discard a card, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: The only thing unlucky about Absol is its appearance. It protects fields and warns people of disaster, so one ought to be grateful for it.

data.name: Crabominable

attacks.name: Avalanche
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.

data.name: Stufful
data.flavorText: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.

data.name: Green's Exploration
rules: You can play this card only if you have no Pokémon with Abilities in play.
Search your deck for up to 2 Trainer cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ultra Forest Kartenvoy
rules: During this turn, damage from your Ultra Beasts' attacks isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Garchomp & Giratina-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Calamitous Slash
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: GG End-GX
attacks.text: Discard 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and all cards attached to it. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fighting Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard 2 of your opponent's Pokémon instead. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Fairy Charm Lightning
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Prevent all damage done to the Fairy Pokémon this card is attached to by attacks from your opponent's Lightning Pokémon-GX and Lightning Pokémon-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Kricketune

attacks.name: Improvisational Performance
attacks.text: If you have exactly 1 card in your hand, this attack does 100 more damage. If you have exactly 3 cards in your hand, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. If you have exactly 6 cards in your hand, this attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.

data.name: Blacephalon

attacks.name: Fireworks Bomb
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. If your opponent has exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, put 12 damage counters on them instead.

data.flavorText: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

data.name: Mew
data.flavorText: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Bubble Hold
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It doesn't like to be taken care of. It's difficult to bond with since it won't listen to its Trainer.

data.name: Dewpider

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.

data.name: Malamar

attacks.name: Hypnotic Reign
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. You may discard a Pokémon you find there and use one of that Pokémon's non-GX attacks as this attack.

attacks.name: Dark Pressure
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: When it comes to strong hypnosis, there's an endless number of people who utilize Malamar for their nefarious deeds.

data.name: Gligar

abilities.name: Free Flight
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has no Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Shinobi Strike
attacks.text: If you played Janine from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.

data.name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Close examination of its large eyes reveals that each eye is composed of a myriad of tiny eyes.

data.name: Professor Kukui
rules: Draw 2 cards. During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lickilicky

attacks.name: Licks Go Crazy
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand, discard the top card of your opponent's deck, and discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A contest is under way to determine which one can stick its tongue out the farthest. The current record is…more than 82 feet.

data.name: Zubat

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has no eyeballs, so it can't see. It checks its surroundings via the ultrasonic waves it emits from its mouth.

data.name: Steelix

attacks.name: Ground Stream
attacks.text: Attach 2 Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gigaton Shake
attacks.text: During your next turn, your Pokémon can't attack. (This includes Pokémon that come into play on that turn.)

data.flavorText: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.

data.name: Alolan Sandslash

attacks.name: Curve Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Reinforced Needle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: It runs across snow-covered plains at high speeds. It developed thick, sharp claws to plow through the snow.

data.name: Koffing

attacks.name: Foul Odor
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

data.flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.

data.name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke tails and then simmering them into a salty stew.

data.name: Munchlax

abilities.name: Snack Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, put a card from your discard pile on top of your deck. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.flavorText: It hides food under its long fur, but it sometimes forgets about it and causes a stinky disturbance.

data.name: Persian-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Cat Walk
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if 1 of your Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. You can't use more than 1 Cat Walk Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile. You can't add more than 180 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Slash Back-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Stoutland

abilities.name: Arf Arf Bark
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It pays no mind to the cold, thanks to its long warm coat. Stoutland in Alola look a little uncomfortable.

data.name: Blastoise & Piplup-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Splash Maker
attacks.text: You may attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. If you do, heal 50 damage from those Pokémon for each card you attached to them in this way.

attacks.name: Bubble Launcher-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 150 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Tentacool

attacks.name: Bubble Jutsu
attacks.text: If you played Janine from your hand during this turn, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: It drifts through the sea searching for prey. Its poisonous tentacles break off sometimes, but after a while, they grow back.

data.name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Mirror Shot
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.flavorText: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.

data.name: Tirtouga
data.flavorText: It was restored from an ancient fossil. Tirtouga lived in the sea but came up onto the land to search for prey.

data.name: Escavalier

attacks.name: Discerning Spear
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has no damage counters on it before this attack does damage, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.

data.name: Cloyster

attacks.name: Headlock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Its hard shell cannot be shattered—not even by a bomb. The contents of the shell remain unknown.

data.name: Stadium Nav
rules: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Slugma

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.

data.name: Great Catcher
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX with their Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Wishiwashi-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: School Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Wishiwashi and Wishiwashi-GX in play.

attacks.name: Massive Catch-GX
attacks.text: Look at the top 12 cards of your deck and put any number of Basic Pokémon you find there onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Ultra Ball
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pokémon Center Lady
rules: Heal 60 damage and remove all Special Conditions from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Mesprit

attacks.name: First Contact
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Known as "The Being of Emotion." It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

data.name: Brock's Grit
rules: Shuffle 6 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Victreebel

attacks.name: Reactive Poison
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each Special Condition affecting your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gastro Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon has no Abilities until the end of your next turn.

data.flavorText: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

data.name: Rufflet

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: With its powerful legs and sturdy claws, it can crack even the hard shells of Shellder and pluck out their insides.

data.name: Meowstic

attacks.name: Caturday
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Perplexing Eyes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon's Weakness is now Psychic until the end of your next turn. (The amount of Weakness doesn't change.)

data.flavorText: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.

data.name: Rosa
rules: You can play this card only if 1 of your Pokémon was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.
Search your deck for a Pokémon, a Trainer card, and a basic Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Munna

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of either player's deck and put them back in any order.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.

data.name: Jirachi-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Zone
abilities.text: Don't apply Psychic Weakness when Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) take damage from attacks.

attacks.name: Star Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Psychic Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Star Shield-GX
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Mawile-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Captivating Wink
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may have your opponent reveal their hand and put any number of Basic Pokémon you find there onto their Bench.

attacks.name: Wily Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Eater-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard all Supporter cards you find there. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Hypno

abilities.name: Hypnotic Pendulum
abilities.text: When your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out, flip a coin. If heads, choose which of your opponent's Benched Pokémon becomes their new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stir the Brain
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: In Alola, Komala is Hypno's main target. It rarely harms people.

data.name: Pokégear 3.0
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Supporter card you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lucario & Melmetal-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Steel Fist
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metal Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Full Metal Wall-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your Metal Pokémon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard all Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Kartana

attacks.name: Big Cut
attacks.text: If you have exactly 4 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 120 more damage.

attacks.name: False Swipe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

data.flavorText: This Ultra Beast's body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.

data.name: Sandile

attacks.name: Grandiose Fangs
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, this Pokémon's attacks do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon during your next turn (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Alola, where it's warm all year round, is a comfortable environment for this Pokémon. Sometimes you'll even see it outside of deserts.

data.name: Mewtwo & Mew-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Perfection
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX on your Bench or in your discard pile. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: Miraculous Duo-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Jolteon

abilities.name: Electromagnetic Wall
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its lungs contain an organ that creates electricity. The crackling sound of electricity can be heard when it exhales.

data.name: Trumbeak

attacks.name: Bullet Seed
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of call and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.

data.name: Caterpie

abilities.name: Pupate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Perhaps because it would like to grow up quickly, it has a voracious appetite, eating a hundred leaves a day.

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it over, and then another Weavile will deal the finishing blow with its sharp claws.

data.name: Ekans
data.flavorText: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.

data.name: Koga's Trap
rules: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Exeggcute

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Six of them form a single Pokémon. Should one of the six be lost, the next morning there will once more be six.

data.name: Tranquill

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.

data.name: Draw Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
When you attach this card from your hand to a Pokémon, draw a card.

data.name: Oddish

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: During the day, It stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

data.name: Arbok

abilities.name: Last Pattern
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, discard 2 random cards from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Rocket Tail
attacks.text: If Jessie & James is in your discard pile, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: The latest research has determined that there are over 20 possible arrangements of the patterns on its stomach.

data.name: Dartrix

attacks.name: Sharp Blade Quill
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.

data.name: Quagsire
data.flavorText: It has a sluggish nature. It lies at the river's bottom, waiting for prey to stray into its mouth.

data.name: Finneon
data.flavorText: When night falls, their pink patterns begin to shine. They're popular with divers, so there are resorts that feed them to keep them close.

data.name: Alolan Grimer

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
