attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: There are a hundred or so of them living in Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all hard workers who eat a lot of trash.

data.name: Mallow & Lana
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
When you play this card, you may discard 2 other cards from your hand. If you do, heal 120 damage from the Pokémon you moved to your Bench.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Drampa

attacks.name: Dragon Arcana
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has 2 or more different types of basic Energy attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: If a child it has made friends with is bullied, Drampa will find the bully's house and burn it to the ground.

data.name: Grimsley
rules: Move up to 3 damage counters from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of their Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: During the day, It stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

data.name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Grand Flame
attacks.text: Attach 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Legends tell of its fighting alongside a general and conquering a whole country.

data.name: Hypno

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: As a matter of course, it makes anyone it meets fall asleep and has a taste of their dreams. Anyone having a good dream, it carries off.

data.name: Marshadow & Machamp-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Acme of Heroism-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), and if it would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their next turn, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Varied Pollen
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose Asleep, Burned, Confused, or Poisoned. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giant Bloom
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

data.name: Muk & Alolan Muk-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 8 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Poison Absorption
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, heal 100 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nasty Goo Mix-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. If this Pokémon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), put 15 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Aerodactyl-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Primal Winds
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Basic Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more.

attacks.name: Wild Dive-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Tag Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your TAG TEAM Pokémon in play.

data.flavorText: Kangaskhan protects its child by keeping it in its pouch. It has zero forgiveness for those who harm its child and will beat them down.

data.name: Alolan Persian-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Smug Face
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's TAG TEAM Pokémon and Ultra Beasts, and by your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy attached to them.

attacks.name: Stalking Claws-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pokémon Catcher
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Hakamo-o

abilities.name: Fighter's Roar
abilities.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, this Pokémon can evolve during the turn you play it.

data.flavorText: It makes noise by clanging its scales together. When the rhythm has reached its peak, Hakamo-o attacks.

data.name: Charizard & Braixen-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brilliant Flare
attacks.text: You may search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Crimson Flame Pillar-GX
attacks.text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Confused. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Misty & Lorelei
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
When you play this card, you may discard 5 other cards from your hand. If you do, during this turn, your Water Pokémon can use their GX attacks even if you have used your GX attack.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Woobat

attacks.name: Nasal Suction
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Air Cutter
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

data.name: Melmetal

abilities.name: Metal Eater
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Metal Pokémon from your hand. If you do, heal 100 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.

data.name: Volcanion

attacks.name: Flare Starter
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If you go second and it's your first turn, instead search for up to 3 Fire Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: High-Heat Blast
attacks.text: If you have at least 4 Fire Energy in play, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.

data.name: Pancham
data.flavorText: It follows Pangoro around like a henchman. When Pancham makes a big mistake, its leaf gets taken away.

data.name: Poliwrath

attacks.name: Swirly Rush
attacks.text: If Poliwag and Poliwhirl are on your Bench, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: It's quite a gifted swimmer, even among Water-type Pokémon, but it normally spends its time on land.

data.name: Lycanroc

abilities.name: Boiling Blood
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX in play, this Pokémon's attacks cost ColorlessColorlessColorless less.

attacks.name: Voltage Claw
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has no problem ignoring orders it doesn't like. It doesn't seem to mind getting hurt at all—as long as it can finish off its opponent.

data.name: Will
rules: The next time you flip any number of coins for the effect of an attack, Ability, or Trainer card this turn, choose heads or tails for the first coin flip.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Charizard & Braixen-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brilliant Flare
attacks.text: You may search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Crimson Flame Pillar-GX
attacks.text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Confused. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Marshadow & Machamp-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Acme of Heroism-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), and if it would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their next turn, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Palpitoad

attacks.name: Mini Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.

data.name: Metal Core Barrier
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your opponent's turn.
The Metal Pokémon this card is attached to takes 70 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tag Call
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 TAG TEAM cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Dusk Stone
rules: Search your deck for a Mismagius, Honchkrow, Chandelure, or Aegislash, including Pokémon-GX, that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon in play, and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. You can use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Herdier

attacks.name: Work Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 60 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: The longer its black fur grows, the harder and more impervious it gets. Claws and fangs can't easily penetrate it.

data.name: Lapras-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Ice Beam-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Glameow

attacks.name: Caturday
attacks.text: Draw a card. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Boing Boing Tail
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.

data.name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's still not very good at walking. Its Trainers should train this Pokémon to walk every day.

data.name: Yanma
data.flavorText: Its eyes can see 360 degrees without moving its head. It won't miss prey—even those behind it.

data.name: Fearow

attacks.name: Drill Run Double
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Carrying food through Fearow's territory is dangerous. It will snatch the food away from you in a flash!

data.name: Raichu & Alolan Raichu-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tandem Shock
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 80 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lightning Ride-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 100 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Snorunt

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It feeds mainly on ice and snow. It's only able to survive in a limited number of places in the warm Alola region.

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.

data.name: Solgaleo & Lunala-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Cosmic Burn during your next turn.

attacks.name: Light of the Protector-GX
attacks.text: If you played Lillie's Full Force from your hand during this turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to each of your Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Reset Stamp
rules: Your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck and draws a card for each of their remaining Prize cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Poliwag

abilities.name: Round ‘n' Round
abilities.text: You can use this Ability only if you go second. Once during your first turn (before your attack), you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Confused.

data.flavorText: Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land. So it does its best to waddle along, but when an enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.

data.name: Cubone

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead mother. According to some, it will evolve when it comes to terms with the pain of her death.

data.name: Togepi & Cleffa & Igglybuff-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rolling Panic
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Supreme Puff-GX
attacks.text: Take another turn after this one. (Skip the between-turns step.) If this Pokémon has at least 14 extra Fairy Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles all of their Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to them into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Doll Swap
attacks.text: Put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand. If you do, you may play Lillie's Poké Doll from your hand as your new Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They're popular, but they're rare. Trainers who show them off recklessly may be targeted by thieves.

data.name: Koffing

abilities.name: Blow-Away Bomb
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you discard this Pokémon with the effect of Roxie, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Place damage counters after the effect of Roxie.)

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.

attacks.name: Barrier Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Special Laser
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: It looks somehow pained as it rages around in search of light, which serves as its energy. It's apparently from another world.

data.name: Crustle

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 80 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 150 more damage.

data.flavorText: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.

data.name: Wigglytuff-GX

attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Ponyta

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.

data.name: Lickilicky

attacks.name: Eat Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If you discarded a Pokémon Tool card in this way, heal all damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tonguenado
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: A contest is under way to determine which one can stick its tongue out the farthest. The current record is…more than 82 feet.

data.name: Aromatisse

attacks.name: Pungent Aroma
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is heads, your opponent reveals their hand. For each heads, choose a card you find there. Your opponent shuffles those cards into their deck.

attacks.name: Miraculous Cologne
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

data.flavorText: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.

data.name: Moltres & Zapdos & Articuno-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sky Legends-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Fire, Water, and Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 110 damage to 3 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Chaotic Swell
rules: Whenever either player plays a Stadium card from their hand, discard that Stadium card after discarding this one. (The new Stadium card has no effect.)
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Rhyperior

attacks.name: Hefty Cannon
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Break Ground
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.

attacks.name: Shinobi Mastery
attacks.text: If you played Koga's Trap from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage. If you played Janine from your hand during this turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Ten-Card Return-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.

attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon wanders across time. Grass and trees flourish in the forests in which it has appeared.

data.name: Carvanha

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: They're such cowards that they won't hunt alone. When five or so of them get together, they suddenly turn ferocious!

data.flavorText: It's proud of its thick horn. In Alola, its biggest rival is Vikavolt, which it's always fighting with.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Beat attack's base damage is 80.

data.flavorText: At night, it weeps loudly for its dead mother, but those cries only attract its natural enemy—Mandibuzz.

You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.flavorText: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.

data.name: Fairy Charm Ability

Prevent all damage done to the Fairy Pokémon this card is attached to by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX that have Abilities.

data.flavorText: Known as "The Being of Willpower." It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

abilities.name: Bench Barrier

attacks.name: Psypower

data.flavorText: Its two antennae glow softly to lure in prey, making it a useful Pokémon for night fishing.

attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tropical Hour-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles all Energy from all of their Pokémon into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Great Potion
rules: Heal 50 damage from your Active Pokémon-GX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Crabominable

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Freezing Punch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!

data.name: Lana's Fishing Rod
rules: Shuffle a Pokémon and a Pokémon Tool card from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Moltres & Zapdos & Articuno-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sky Legends-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Fire, Water, and Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 110 damage to 3 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land. So it does its best to waddle along, but when an enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.

data.name: Kingler

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.

data.name: Zubat

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.flavorText: It sleeps in caves during the day. It has no eyes, so to check its surroundings while flying, it emits ultrasonic waves.

data.name: Musharna

attacks.name: Rest Well
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Asleep. During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 100 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.

data.name: Litleo
data.flavorText: When they're young, they live with a pride. Once they're able to hunt prey on their own, they're kicked out and have to make their own way.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: It knows how people and Pokémon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn't approach dangerous opponents.

data.name: Unidentified Fossil
rules: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Colorless Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may discard this card from play.
This card can't retreat.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Parental Fury
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Kangaskhan protects its child by keeping it in its pouch. It has zero forgiveness for those who harm its child and will beat them down.

data.name: Dratini

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Dratini, a Dragonair, and a Dragonite, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: After a 10-hour struggle, a fisherman was able to pull one up and confirm its existence.

data.name: Araquanid

attacks.name: Liquidation
attacks.text: During your next turn, the Defending Pokémon takes 60 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It usually passes its time in the water. When its belly is full, it stores its subdued prey in the water bubble on its head.

data.name: Deerling
data.flavorText: Their coloring changes according to the season and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.

data.name: Silvally-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Disk Reload
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Brave Buddies
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Silver Knight-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Ultra Beast, it is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Froakie

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

data.name: Rockruff

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: As they develop, their disposition grows more violent and aggressive. Many Trainers find them too much to handle and abandon them.

data.name: Trevenant

attacks.name: Perplexing Forest
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Impact
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's feared as a ghost of the forest. Lumberjacks bring along Fire types, which Trevenant hates, when they enter the forest.

data.name: Timer Ball
rules: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, search your deck for an Evolution Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Steenee

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.

data.name: Pyukumuku

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Surprise Fist
attacks.text: You and your opponent play Rock-Paper-Scissors. If you win, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: The tradition known as Pyukumuku chucking started from the custom of throwing Pyukumuku back into the sea after they wash onshore.

data.name: Decidueye-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Feather Arrow
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hollow Hunt-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Red's Challenge
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Cottonee

attacks.name: Lost March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon, except p (Prism Star) Pokémon, in the Lost Zone.

data.flavorText: To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body. When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows moist and heavy, and it can't move as well.

data.name: Guzzlord

attacks.name: Mountain Munch
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Red Banquet
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

data.flavorText: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

data.name: Rhyhorn
data.flavorText: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.

data.name: Dragalge

attacks.name: Poison Cultivation
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, put 10 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.flavorText: This vicious Pokémon sprays a poisonous liquid on opponents that come near. For whatever reason, it gets along really well with Dhelmise.

data.name: Beast Bringer
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

If you have exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, and if your opponent's Active Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of the Ultra Beast this card is attached to, take 1 more Prize card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Charmeleon
data.flavorText: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.

data.name: Tangrowth

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Chlorowhip
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 2 Grass Energy attached to it, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

data.name: Mareanie

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.

data.name: Lillie
rules: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If it's your first turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Stealthy Hood
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Prevent all effects of your opponent's Abilities done to the Pokémon this card is attached to. Remove any such existing effects.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Alolan Raticate

attacks.name: Evil Orders
attacks.text: Search your deck for a number of cards up to the number of your Benched Pokémon and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Endeavor
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: This gourmet Pokémon is particular about the taste and freshness of its food. Restaurants where Raticate live have a good reputation.

data.name: Alolan Diglett
data.flavorText: Although it's powerful enough to dig right through volcanic rock, it doesn't allow itself to be seen very often.

data.name: Gliscor

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

data.name: Foongus

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.

data.name: Heliolisk

attacks.name: Parabolic Counter
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Lightning Pokémon in play, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

data.name: Armaldo

attacks.name: Ancient Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Unidentified Fossil card in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Mach Claw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: It lived on land and went out into the sea to hunt for prey. Its sharp claws were its greatest weapon.

data.name: Drowzee

attacks.name: Psychic Boom
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It finds really fun dreams tasty. When it makes friends with people, it may show them the most delicious dreams it's ever eaten.

data.name: Mareanie
data.flavorText: They eat Corsola branches, so Mareanie are hated by craftsmen who work with Corsola branches that have naturally fallen off.

data.name: Sandile

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.

data.name: Magneton

abilities.name: Call Signal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for up to 3 Supporter cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. If you searched your deck in this way, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

data.flavorText: Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas inhabited by Magneton, which send out mysterious electrical signals.

data.name: Palossand

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Each of its grains of sand has its own will. Palossand eats small Pokémon and siphons away their vital essence while they're still alive.

data.name: Channeler
rules: Remove all effects of attacks on you and each of your Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Reshiram & Zekrom-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fabled Flarebolts
attacks.text: Discard up to 3 in any combination of basic Fire and basic Lightning Energy cards from your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Cross Break-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If you played N's Resolve from your hand during this turn, this attack also does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's other Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Silvally

attacks.name: Avenging Heart
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Prize card your opponent took on their last turn.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This is its form once it has awakened and evolved. Freed from its heavy mask, its speed is greatly increased.

data.name: Greninja

attacks.name: Bring Down
attacks.text: The Pokémon that has the least HP remaining, except for this Pokémon, is Knocked Out. (If multiple Pokémon are tied, choose one.)

attacks.name: Mist Slash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

data.name: Weakness Guard Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
The Pokémon this card is attached to has no Weakness.

data.name: Oddish

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

data.name: Pokégear 3.0
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Supporter card you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Dugtrio

attacks.name: Home Ground
attacks.text: If you have any Stadium card in play, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: While the three of them normally get along splendidly, on rare occasions a huge fight will break out over which head gets to eat first.

data.name: Crushing Hammer
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Oranguru

attacks.name: Sage's Riddle
attacks.text: Put a Pokémon from your hand face down in front of you. Your opponent guesses the type of that Pokémon, and then you reveal it. If your opponent guessed right, they draw 4 cards. If they guessed wrong, you draw 4 cards. Return the Pokémon to your hand.

data.flavorText: It normally spends its time meditating in the treetops. It throws Poké Balls and gives other Pokémon orders as it pleases.

data.name: Heatran-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Burning Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to become your Active Pokémon, you may move any number of Fire Energy from your other Pokémon to it.

attacks.name: Hot Burn-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Poipole

attacks.name: Last Scene
attacks.text: If each player has exactly 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 130 more damage.

data.flavorText: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.

data.name: Eelektross

abilities.name: Electric Swamp
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your hand and you have at least 4 Lightning Energy cards in play, you may play this Pokémon onto your Bench. If you do, move any number of Lightning Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hover Over
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.

data.name: Lapras

abilities.name: Mermaid's Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put a Misty's Favor card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: It likes swimming around with people on its back. In the Alola region, it's an important means of transportation over water.

data.name: Drilbur

attacks.name: Rototiller
attacks.text: Shuffle a card from your discard pile into your deck.

data.flavorText: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.

data.name: Incineroar

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Darkest Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it's not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer's orders with complete nonchalance.

data.name: Mega Sableye & Tyranitar-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Greedy Crush
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Gigafall-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 5 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard the top 15 cards of your opponent's deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Coach Trainer
rules: Draw 2 cards. If your Active Pokémon is a TAG TEAM Pokémon, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ilima
rules: Each player shuffles their hand into their deck and flips a coin. If heads, that player draws 6 cards. If tails, they draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Naganadel-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Conversion
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard an Ultra Beast card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Venom Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Injection-GX
attacks.text: Add a card from your opponent's discard pile to their Prize cards face down. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Oricorio-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dance of Tribute
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may draw 3 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dance of Tribute Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Strafe-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Fearow

attacks.name: Devastating Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 3 cards.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

data.flavorText: Drawings of a Pokémon resembling Fearow can be seen in murals from deep in ancient history.

data.name: Abomasnow

attacks.name: Quick Freeze
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, it is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as "The Ice Monster."

data.name: Raichu & Alolan Raichu-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tandem Shock
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 80 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lightning Ride-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 100 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Rhyhorn

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.

data.name: Lurantis-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flower Supply
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Solar Blade
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chloroscythe-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Togepi & Cleffa & Igglybuff-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rolling Panic
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Supreme Puff-GX
attacks.text: Take another turn after this one. (Skip the between-turns step.) If this Pokémon has at least 14 extra Fairy Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles all of their Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to them into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Blizzard Town
rules: Pokémon with 40 HP or less remaining (both yours and your opponent's) can't attack.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Espeon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Divide-GX
attacks.text: Put 10 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Groudon

attacks.name: Drought
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Fighting Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Trembling Ground
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Trembling Ground during your next turn.

data.flavorText: Said to have expanded the lands by evaporating water with raging heat. It battled titanically with Kyogre.

data.name: Golbat

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Every once in a while, you'll see a Golbat that's missing some fangs. This happens when hunger drives it to try biting a Steel-type Pokémon.

data.name: Grimsley
rules: Move up to 3 damage counters from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of their Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Torracat

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer's whole body covered in scratches.

data.name: Garchomp & Giratina-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Calamitous Slash
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: GG End-GX
attacks.text: Discard 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and all cards attached to it. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fighting Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard 2 of your opponent's Pokémon instead. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Hapu
rules: Look at the top 6 cards of your deck and put 2 of them into your hand. Discard the other cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Floette

abilities.name: Flower Picking
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may choose 2 random cards from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into their deck.

data.flavorText: It raises flowers and uses them as weapons. The more gorgeous the blossom, the more power it contains.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Lightning and Metal type.

attacks.name: Magnetic Bolt
attacks.text: Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: It uses radar to monitor its territory. Intruders are quickly disposed of with a hyper beam.

data.name: Caterpie

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.

data.name: Gardevoir & Sylveon-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fairy Song
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fairy Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Kaleidostorm
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Magical Miracle-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fairy Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it over, and then another Weavile will deal the finishing blow with its sharp claws.

data.name: Pyroar

attacks.name: Swirling Inferno
attacks.text: Discard all Pokémon Tool cards and Special Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The males are usually lazy, but when attacked by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends with no regard for its own safety.

data.name: Genesect

abilities.name: Fast-Flight Configuration
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Splitting Beam
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.

data.name: Xatu

attacks.name: Creepy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Life Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

data.flavorText: It's said that while this Pokémon has the power to predict the future, it's not powerful enough to change the future it sees.

data.name: Spearow

attacks.name: Peck Bugs
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Grass Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Farmers whose fields are troubled by bug Pokémon appreciate Spearow for its vigorous appetite and look after it.

data.name: Alolan Persian

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Claw Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its round face and smooth coat—softer than the most high-class velvet—have made this a very popular Pokémon in Alola.

data.name: Slowpoke & Psyduck-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ditch and Splash
attacks.text: Discard any number of Supporter cards from your hand. This attack does 40 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Thrilling Times-GX
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 100 more damage. If this Pokémon has at least 6 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), flip 10 coins instead, and this attack does 100 more damage for each heads. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Empoleon

attacks.name: Recall
attacks.text: Choose an attack from 1 of this Pokémon's previous Evolutions and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Aquafall
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.

data.name: Gible
data.flavorText: It reacts to anything that moves—flies right at it and bites it. Sometimes it injures itself, but it doesn't care too much.

data.name: Keldeo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Pure Heart
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Resolute Blade-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Mega Sableye & Tyranitar-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Greedy Crush
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Gigafall-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 5 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard the top 15 cards of your opponent's deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Clefable
data.flavorText: It can't help but hear a pin drop from over half a mile away, so it lives deep in the mountains where there aren't many people or Pokémon.

data.name: Emboar

abilities.name: Explosive Fire Dance
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 8 cards of your deck and attach any number of basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.flavorText: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

data.name: Boldore

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: It explores caves in search of underground water. It's not comfortable around water, so this Pokémon takes great care in lapping it up.

data.name: Bidoof

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.

data.name: U-Turn Board
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is Colorless less.
If this card is discarded from play, put it into your hand instead of the discard pile.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Umbreon & Darkrai-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Black Lance
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-GX or Benched Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dark Moon-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from their hand during their next turn. If this Pokémon has at least 5 extra Darkness Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Wishiwashi

abilities.name: Scatter
abilities.text: At the end of your opponent's turn, if this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, flip a coin. If tails, shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

data.flavorText: Wishiwashi assemble in this formation to face off against strong foes. It boasts a strength that earned it the name "demon of the sea."

data.name: Swoobat

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Charming Stamp
attacks.text: Your opponent chooses 1 of their own Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.

data.name: Crabominable

attacks.name: Fight Alone
attacks.text: If you have fewer Pokémon in play than your opponent, this attack does 50 more damage for each Pokémon fewer you have in play.

data.flavorText: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!

data.name: Mawile

attacks.name: Dual Calling
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 TAG TEAM cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: A cunning and terrifying Pokémon, its cuteness makes opponents let down their guard—and then it swallows them whole with its huge jaws.

data.name: Glalie

attacks.name: Ice Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed, and discard an Energy from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Frosty Typhoon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Frosty Typhoon during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It freezes its prey and chews them whole. However, it prefers to eat Pokémon like Vanillite that are already frozen.

data.name: Celesteela-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Force Canceler
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, prevent all effects of your opponent's GX attacks, including damage, done to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Discovery-GX
attacks.text: Count your Prize cards and put them into your hand. Then, take that many cards from the top of your deck and put them face down as your Prize cards. If you don't have that many cards in your deck, this attack does nothing. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Dust Island
rules: Whenever either player switches their Poisoned Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon with the effect of a Trainer card, the new Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Toxapex
data.flavorText: To attack, this Pokémon sends toxic spikes flying at its enemies. Ones that come close get mown down by the claws on its feet.

data.name: Muk & Alolan Muk-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 8 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Poison Absorption
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, heal 100 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nasty Goo Mix-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. If this Pokémon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), put 15 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Stufful

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It boasts power enough to split large trees in half. The organ on its rear releases an odor that it uses to communicate with others of its kind.

data.name: Salazzle

abilities.name: Roast Reveal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

data.flavorText: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.

data.name: Eevee

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: When you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon that is the same type as that Energy card and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

data.flavorText: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.

data.name: Charizard-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz-GX
attacks.text: (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

data.name: Drilbur
data.flavorText: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.

data.name: Persian-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Cat Walk
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if 1 of your Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. You can't use more than 1 Cat Walk Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile. You can't add more than 180 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Slash Back-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Paras
data.flavorText: No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms growing on its back steal away most of the nutrients it consumes.

data.name: Inkay

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It draws prey near with its blinking lights and then wraps them up in its long tentacles and holds them in place.

data.name: Tauros-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mad Bull-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Solgaleo

abilities.name: Armor of the Sunne
abilities.text: If you have Lunala in play, your Solgaleo and Lunala take 50 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Armor of the Sunne Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Sol Fangs
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Sometimes the result of its opening an Ultra Wormhole is that energy and life-forms from other worlds are called here to this world.

data.name: Poké Maniac
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon that have a Retreat Cost of exactly 4, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rotom

attacks.name: Cycle Draw
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.

data.name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.

data.name: Magmar
data.flavorText: Its entire body is burning. When it breathes, the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames shoot out!

data.name: Alolan Grimer

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.flavorText: There are a hundred or so of them living in Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all hard workers who eat a lot of trash.

data.name: Drifblim

abilities.name: Tag Transport
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active TAG TEAM Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: There's a rumor that if you catch a Drifblim floating on the wind at dusk, you'll be carried away to the afterlife.

data.name: Power Plant
rules: Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Ultra Ball
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Slowpoke & Psyduck-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ditch and Splash
attacks.text: Discard any number of Supporter cards from your hand. This attack does 40 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Thrilling Times-GX
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 100 more damage. If this Pokémon has at least 6 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), flip 10 coins instead, and this attack does 100 more damage for each heads. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Power Plant
rules: Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Eevee

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: The question of why only Eevee has such unstable genes has still not been solved.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: It knows how people and Pokémon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn't approach dangerous opponents.

data.name: Molayne
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 Metal Energy cards from your hand.
Shuffle a Trainer card from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

data.name: Clefable

attacks.name: Moon-Watching Dance
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Pokémon that has any Fairy Energy attached to it.

data.flavorText: It can't help but hear a pin drop from over half a mile away, so it lives deep in the mountains where there aren't many people or Pokémon.

data.name: Tympole

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.

data.name: Venusaur & Snivy-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shining Vine
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, when you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to it, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Solar Plant-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Gastly

abilities.name: Swelling Spite
abilities.text: When this Pokémon is Knocked Out, search your deck for up to 2 Haunter and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It's said that gas emanating from a graveyard was possessed by the grievances of the deceased and thus became a Pokémon.

data.name: Aerodactyl-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Primal Winds
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Basic Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more.

attacks.name: Wild Dive-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Sewaddle

attacks.name: Multiply
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Sewaddle and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

data.name: Recycle Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
If this card is discarded from play, put it into your hand instead of the discard pile.

data.name: Ambipom

attacks.name: Nice-Nice Catch
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Bye-Bye Throw
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 cards from your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: In their search for comfortable trees, they get into territorial disputes with groups of Passimian. They win about half the time.

data.name: Gumshoos

attacks.name: Alert Headbutt
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, this attack's base damage is 30.

data.flavorText: Although it wasn't originally found in Alola, this Pokémon was brought over a long time ago when there was a huge Rattata outbreak.

data.name: Unidentified Fossil
rules: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Colorless Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may discard this card from play.
This card can't retreat.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Mewtwo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psycrush-GX
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Probopass

attacks.name: Hard Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Triple Nose
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Although it can control its units known as Mini-Noses, they sometimes get lost and don't come back.

data.name: Caterpie
data.flavorText: Perhaps because it would like to grow up quickly, it has a voracious appetite, eating a hundred leaves a day.

data.name: Reshiram & Charizard-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flare Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Flare Strike during your next turn.

attacks.name: Double Blaze-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fire Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 100 more damage, and this attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Janine
rules: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put 2 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Purugly

attacks.name: Stray Cat Dash
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand. If this Pokémon evolved from Glameow during this turn, discard 2 cards instead of 1.

data.flavorText: It would claim another Pokémon's nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.

data.name: Skrelp

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It vanishes into seaweed and remains perfectly still to avoid attacks from large Pokémon. Rotten seaweed is its main food source.

data.name: Blastoise & Piplup-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Splash Maker
attacks.text: You may attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. If you do, heal 50 damage from those Pokémon for each card you attached to them in this way.

attacks.name: Bubble Launcher-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 150 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Noivern

attacks.name: Boomburst
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck.

data.flavorText: Although it has a violent disposition, if you give it a nice ripe fruit that it loves, Noivern will suddenly become tame.

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Blastoise-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rocket Splash
attacks.text: Shuffle any amount of Water Energy from your Pokémon into your deck. This attack does 60 damage for each card you shuffled into your deck in this way.

attacks.name: Giant Geyser-GX
attacks.text: Attach any number of Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pinsir

attacks.name: Roof Fling
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put your opponent's Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: One solid blow from its horns is enough to split apart a large tree. Its greatest rival in Alola is Vikavolt.

data.name: Slumbering Forest
rules: If a Pokémon is Asleep, its owner flips 2 coins instead of 1 for that Special Condition between turns. If either of them is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Assault Boom
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: It throws bones at Mandibuzz to knock it down. It's thought that Marowak is trying to avenge its parent.
