data.name: Chinchou

attacks.name: Searching Light
attacks.text: Look at 1 of your face-down Prize cards.

data.flavorText: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.

data.name: Honedge

attacks.name: Slashing Cutter
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.

data.name: Greninja & Zoroark-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Pulse
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Union-GX
attacks.text: Put 2 in any combination of Darkness Pokémon-GX and Darkness Pokémon-EX from your discard pile onto your Bench. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), attach 2 Energy cards from your discard pile to each Pokémon that you put onto your Bench in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Giratina

abilities.name: Dimension Breach
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fade to Black
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.

data.name: Welder
rules: Attach up to 2 Fire Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Spiritomb

abilities.name: Building Spite
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 1 damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Anguish Cry
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.

data.name: Golett

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

data.flavorText: Its movements are powered by a mysterious energy. It has continued to move since ancient times, so its power may soon run out.

data.name: Solgaleo & Lunala-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cosmic Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Cosmic Burn during your next turn.

attacks.name: Light of the Protector-GX
attacks.text: If you played Lillie's Full Force from your hand during this turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to each of your Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cutiefly

attacks.name: Fly Around
attacks.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

data.flavorText: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it's able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.

data.name: Slakoth

attacks.name: Lazy Howl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if they attach an Energy card from their hand to the Defending Pokémon, their turn ends.

data.flavorText: The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.

data.name: Venonat

attacks.name: Radar Eyes
attacks.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.flavorText: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

data.name: Aegislash

abilities.name: Durable Blade
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put it into your hand instead of the discard pile. (Discard all cards attached to it.)

attacks.name: Trash Slash
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each Item card in your discard pile. You can't do more than 130 damage in this way.

data.flavorText: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.

data.name: Raichu & Alolan Raichu-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tandem Shock
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 80 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lightning Ride-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 100 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cosmoem

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.

data.name: Unfezant

attacks.name: Downburst
attacks.text: You may have each player shuffle all cards attached to their Active Pokémon into their deck.

data.flavorText: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females' flying abilities surpass those of the males.

data.name: Paras
data.flavorText: Whether it's due to a lack of moisture or a lack of nutrients, in Alola the mushrooms on Paras don't grow up quite right.

data.name: Flygon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dusty Defense
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, all of your Pokémon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Desert Hurricane
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 120 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge-GX
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Fraxure

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.

data.name: Mawile-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Captivating Wink
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may have your opponent reveal their hand and put any number of Basic Pokémon you find there onto their Bench.

attacks.name: Wily Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Eater-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard all Supporter cards you find there. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Gumshoos-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Search the Premises
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent reveal their hand.

attacks.name: Gumshoe Chance-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Raticate

attacks.name: Escaping Incisors
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: People say that it fled from its enemies by using its small webbed hind feet to swim from island to island in Alola.

data.name: Drapion

attacks.name: Cross Poison
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads. If at least 2 of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It takes pride in its strength. Even though it can tear foes apart, it finishes them off with powerful poison.

data.name: Crabrawler
data.flavorText: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.

data.name: Kricketot

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.

data.name: Palossand

abilities.name: Wall of Sand
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Absorb Vitality
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.

data.name: Sneasel

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: They will cooperate to steal eggs from the nests of bird Pokémon, but fights break out to determine which one gets to eat the eggs.

data.name: Onix

attacks.name: Dig Deep
attacks.text: Put an Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Tail Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.

data.name: Roggenrola

attacks.name: Smack Down
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has Fighting Resistance, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: The hexagonal cavity is its ear. It walks in the direction of sounds it hears, but if the sounds cease, it panics and topples over.

data.name: Jirachi-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Zone
abilities.text: Don't apply Psychic Weakness when Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) take damage from attacks.

attacks.name: Star Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Psychic Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Star Shield-GX
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Mewtwo & Mew-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Perfection
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX on your Bench or in your discard pile. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: Miraculous Duo-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Anorith
data.flavorText: When restored Anorith are released into the ocean, they don't thrive, because the water composition has changed since their era.

data.name: Gloom

abilities.name: Irresistible Aroma
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if your opponent's Bench isn't full, you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent reveals their hand. Put a Basic Pokémon you find there onto their Bench.

data.flavorText: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.

data.name: Meditite

attacks.name: Spirited Headbutt
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Spirited Headbutt during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It always trains deep in mountains. It levitates when it heightens its spiritual power through meditation.

data.name: Leavanny

abilities.name: Blanket Weaver
abilities.text: Your Grass Pokémon take 40 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Blanket Weaver Ability at a time.

data.flavorText: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.

data.name: Jessie & James
rules: Each player discards 2 cards from their hand. Your opponent discards first.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Wingull

attacks.name: Roost
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon. It can't retreat during your next turn.

data.flavorText: Fishermen keep an eye out for Wingull in the sky, because wherever they're circling, the ocean sure to be is teeming with fish Pokémon.

data.name: Rotom Dex
rules: After counting your Prize cards, shuffle them into your deck. Then, take that many cards from the top of your deck and put them face down as your Prize cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Flabébé

attacks.name: Petal Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It's not safe without the power of a flower, but it will keep traveling around until it finds one with the color and shape it wants.

data.name: Guzma & Hala
rules: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
When you play this card, you may discard 2 other cards from your hand. If you do, you may also search for a Pokémon Tool card and a Special Energy card in this way.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Heatran-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Burning Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to become your Active Pokémon, you may move any number of Fire Energy from your other Pokémon to it.

attacks.name: Hot Burn-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Red & Blue
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon-GX that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.)
When you play this card, you may discard 2 other cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to the Pokémon you evolved in this way.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Giant Bomb
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your opponent's turn.

If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and takes 180 or more damage from an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 10 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Torracat

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.

data.name: Alolan Muk

abilities.name: Power of Alchemy
abilities.text: Each Basic Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: While it's unexpectedly quiet and friendly, if it's not fed any trash for a while, it will smash its Trainer's furnishings and eat up the fragments.

data.name: Viridian Forest
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a card from their hand. If they do, that player searches their deck for a basic Energy card, reveals it, and puts it into their hand. Then, that player shuffles their deck.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Mewtwo & Mew-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Perfection
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX on your Bench or in your discard pile. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: Miraculous Duo-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Slurpuff

attacks.name: Olfactory Enchantment
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sweet Panic
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon isn't Confused, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.

data.name: Sandile

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Alola, where it's warm all year round, is a comfortable environment for this Pokémon. Sometimes you'll even see it outside of deserts.

data.name: Lanturn

abilities.name: Blinking Lights
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Swirling Flow
attacks.text: You may have your opponent shuffle their deck.

data.flavorText: When the bacteria living inside its antennae absorb Lanturn's bodily fluids, a strong luminescent effect is produced.

data.name: Flygon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dusty Defense
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, all of your Pokémon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Desert Hurricane
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 120 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge-GX
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Dedenne-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dedechange
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dedechange Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Tingly Return-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. Put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lapras-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Ice Beam-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Volcarona-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Flaming Shot
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Backfire
attacks.text: Put 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

attacks.name: Massive Heat Wave-GX
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Charizard & Braixen-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brilliant Flare
attacks.text: You may search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Crimson Flame Pillar-GX
attacks.text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Confused. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Mega Sableye & Tyranitar-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Greedy Crush
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Gigafall-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 5 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard the top 15 cards of your opponent's deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cherish Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon-GX, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Sableye

attacks.name: Mirror Gem
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put 8 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It digs through the ground with its hard claws and crunches down gems with its thick pointy teeth. Carbink is its favorite food.

data.name: Dragonium Z: Dragon Claw
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to has the Dragon Claw attack, it can use the GX attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Destructive Drake-GX
attacks.text: Discard all basic Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each card you discarded in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Excadrill

attacks.name: Rototiller
attacks.text: Shuffle 4 cards from your discard pile into your deck.

data.flavorText: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

data.name: Cryogonal

attacks.name: Frozen Lock
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from their hand during their next turn.

data.flavorText: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.

data.name: Exp. Share
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
When your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move 1 basic Energy card from that Pokémon to the Pokémon this card is attached to.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Swanna

attacks.name: Tailwind
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.

data.name: Celesteela-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Force Canceler
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, prevent all effects of your opponent's GX attacks, including damage, done to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Discovery-GX
attacks.text: Count your Prize cards and put them into your hand. Then, take that many cards from the top of your deck and put them face down as your Prize cards. If you don't have that many cards in your deck, this attack does nothing. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Phione

abilities.name: Whirlpool Suction
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon. If you do, discard all cards attached to this Pokémon and put it on the bottom of your deck.

data.flavorText: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.

data.name: Graveler

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It climbs up cliffs as it heads toward the peak of a mountain. As soon as it reaches the summit, it rolls back down the way it came.

data.name: Corsola

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Pursued by Mareanie for the branches on its head, this Pokémon will sometimes snap its own branches off as a diversion while it escapes.

data.name: Alolan Marowak

attacks.name: Spirit Smash
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck. If the card you discarded is a Pokémon, this attack does damage equal to that Pokémon's HP to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The rich greenery of the Alola region is hard on Marowak. It controls fire to stay alive.

data.name: Wailord
data.flavorText: They eat so many fish Pokémon that when Wailord become too numerous, fishermen have to chase them off.

data.name: Lillie's Full Force
rules: Draw 4 cards.
At the end of this turn, if you have 3 or more cards in your hand, shuffle cards from your hand into your deck until you have 2 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Espeon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the number of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Divide-GX
attacks.text: Put 10 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Herdier

abilities.name: Treasure Hunt
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: Its dense black fur grows continuously. The high cost of keeping its hard fur properly groomed make this a troublesome Pokémon to train.

data.name: Beast Bringer
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

If you have exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, and if your opponent's Active Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of the Ultra Beast this card is attached to, take 1 more Prize card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Jynx
data.flavorText: It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The precise movements of Jynx living in Alola are truly wonderful.

data.name: Throh

attacks.name: Reverse Shoulder Throw
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.

data.name: Snover

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.

data.name: Vaporeon

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Clean, clear waters are its usual habitat. When it's about to be attacked by an invading enemy, it dives into the water to hide.

data.name: Buzzwole

abilities.name: Beast Boost
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon for each Prize card you have taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Touchdown
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

data.name: Dedenne

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

data.flavorText: It sneaks into people's homes and steals electricity from their outlets. When your electric bill seems off, it's the handiwork of this rascal.

data.name: Yungoos
data.flavorText: Its stomach takes up most of its long torso. It's a big eater, so the amount Trainers have to spend on its food is no laughing matter.

data.name: Jigglypuff

attacks.name: Ball Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Recordings of Jigglypuff's strange lullabies can be purchased from department stores. These CDs can be found near the bedding area.

data.name: Cubone

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: At night, it weeps loudly for its dead mother, but those cries only attract its natural enemy—Mandibuzz.

data.name: Molayne
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 Metal Energy cards from your hand.
Shuffle a Trainer card from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Greninja & Zoroark-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Pulse
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Union-GX
attacks.text: Put 2 in any combination of Darkness Pokémon-GX and Darkness Pokémon-EX from your discard pile onto your Bench. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), attach 2 Energy cards from your discard pile to each Pokémon that you put onto your Bench in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Incineroar

abilities.name: Strong Cheer
abilities.text: Your Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Strong Cheer Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Although it's rough mannered and egotistical, it finds beating down unworthy opponents boring. It gets motivated for stronger opponents.

data.name: Aipom

abilities.name: Scampering Tail
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put the top card of your opponent's deck on the bottom of their deck without looking at it.

data.flavorText: As it did more and more with its tail, its hands became clumsy. It makes its nest high in the treetops.

data.name: Lumineon

attacks.name: Neon Trickery
attacks.text: You may move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Deep down at the bottom of the ocean, prey is scarce. Lumineon get into fierce disputes with Lanturn over food.

data.name: Jynx

abilities.name: Ominous Posture
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Attract Smack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The precise movements of Jynx living in Alola are truly wonderful.

data.name: Meloetta

attacks.name: Tag Cheer
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your TAG TEAM Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shooting Star Pirouette
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

data.name: Steenee

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It's protected by its hard sepals, so it plays with bird Pokémon without worry. They peck it relentlessly, but it doesn't care.

data.name: Shroomish

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.

data.name: Alolan Diglett

attacks.name: Spelunk
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.

data.flavorText: Its head sports an altered form of whiskers made of metal. When in communication with its comrades, its whiskers wobble to and fro.

data.name: Pheromosa & Buzzwole-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jet Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Elegant Sole
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Elegant Sole attack's base damage is 60.

attacks.name: Beast Game-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card. If this Pokémon has at least 7 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 3 more Prize cards instead. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Fletchinder

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It scatters embers in the tall grass. Then bug Pokémon, frightened by the flames, come flying out, and Fletchinder gobbles them up.

data.name: Charjabug

attacks.name: Shocking Jaws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.

data.name: Latios-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Power Bind
abilities.text: If you have 4 or fewer Pokémon in play, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Tag Purge
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from TAG TEAM Pokémon.

attacks.name: Clear Vision-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your opponent can't use any GX attacks. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Chip-Chip Ice Axe
rules: Look at the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck and choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles the other cards back into their deck. Then, put the card you chose on top of their deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Bill's Analysis
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal up to 2 Trainer cards you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Salazzle
data.flavorText: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.

data.name: Venusaur & Snivy-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shining Vine
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, when you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to it, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Solar Plant-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pawniard

attacks.name: Bag Slash
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard an Item card you find there.

data.flavorText: After shredding its prey, it sharpens its blades on a stone by the river. Each Pawniard has its own favorite sharpening stone.

data.name: Lucario & Melmetal-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Steel Fist
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metal Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Full Metal Wall-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your Metal Pokémon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard all Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Froslass

attacks.name: Spiteful Sigh
attacks.text: Put up to 7 damage counters on this Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter you placed in this way.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It freezes hikers who have come to climb snowy mountains and carries them back to its home. It only goes after men it thinks are handsome.

data.name: Professor Kukui
rules: Draw 2 cards. During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Electrode

attacks.name: Electroblast
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of "The Bomb Ball."

data.name: Tepig
data.flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

data.name: Ducklett

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

data.name: Gardevoir & Sylveon-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fairy Song
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fairy Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Kaleidostorm
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Magical Miracle-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fairy Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Full Clean
attacks.text: Discard your hand.

data.flavorText: It engages its enemies using psychic powers. Each of its three heads fires off psychokinetic energy, tripling its power.

data.name: Oricorio-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dance of Tribute
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may draw 3 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dance of Tribute Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Strafe-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Bruxish

attacks.name: Vivid Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Psychic Fangs
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder's shell is no match for it.

data.name: Cosmog
data.flavorText: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.

data.name: Golduck

attacks.name: Double Jet
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Water Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: It is said that the red part of its forehead grants supernatural powers to those who posses one, so it was over-hunted in the past.

data.name: Victini

abilities.name: Victory Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

data.name: Vikavolt

abilities.name: Stealthy Body
abilities.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Electricannon
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has an organ that generates electricity in its abdomen. It concentrates energy in its strong jaws and fires off powerful jolts of electricity.

data.name: Excadrill

attacks.name: Eleventh Hour Tackle
attacks.text: If there are 3 or fewer cards in your deck, this attack does 150 more damage.

attacks.name: Drill Bazooka
attacks.text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

data.flavorText: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

data.name: Alolan Dugtrio

abilities.name: Hair Wall
abilities.text: Your Metal Pokémon take 10 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Its metallic whiskers are heavy, so it's not very fast, but it has the power to dig through bedrock.

data.name: Seismitoad

abilities.name: Bulldoze
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a card, shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.

attacks.name: Tremulous Fist
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

data.flavorText: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.

data.name: Zygarde

abilities.name: Cellular Companions
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, your Zygarde's and Zygarde-GX's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Boost Fang
attacks.text: Attach a Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This is Zygarde when about 10% of its pieces have been assembled. It leaps at its opponent's chest and sinks its sharp fangs into them.

data.name: Fletchling
data.flavorText: While it's an amiable Pokémon, if you touch it unexpectedly, it will heat up its body in an instant, and you'll be burned.

data.name: Blaine's Quiz Show
rules: Put a Pokémon from your hand face down in front of you and tell your opponent the name of an attack it has. Your opponent guesses the name of that Pokémon, and then you reveal it. If your opponent guessed right, they draw 4 cards. If they guessed wrong, you draw 4 cards. Return the Pokémon to your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Porygon

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon was created using the cutting-edge science of 20 years ago, so many parts of it have since become obsolete.

data.name: Kirlia

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: It likes swimming around with people on its back. In the Alola region, it's an important means of transportation over water.

data.name: Jigglypuff
data.flavorText: Recordings of Jigglypuff's strange lullabies can be purchased from department stores. These CDs can be found near the bedding area.

data.name: Dragonite-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sky Judgment
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mach Delivery-GX
attacks.text: You may discard any number of cards from your hand until you have 9 or fewer. Draw cards until you have 10 cards in your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Reshiram & Charizard-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flare Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Flare Strike during your next turn.

attacks.name: Double Blaze-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fire Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 100 more damage, and this attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cosmog

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.

data.name: Dratini

abilities.name: Aqua Lift
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It's still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies of water, eating whatever food sinks down and living a quiet life.

data.name: Umbreon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dark Call-GX
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Geodude
data.flavorText: Geodude that have lived a long life have had all their edges smoothed out until they're totally round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.

data.name: Golem

attacks.name: Steamroller
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Heavy Slam
attacks.text: This attack does 20 less damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their shells. Those that have lived a long, long time have shells green with moss.

data.name: Pokégear 3.0
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Supporter card you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Clay
rules: Discard the top 7 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Item cards, put them into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lapras-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Ice Beam-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Gallade

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Psychic and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.

data.name: Ekans

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.

data.name: Guzma & Hala
rules: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
When you play this card, you may discard 2 other cards from your hand. If you do, you may also search for a Pokémon Tool card and a Special Energy card in this way.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Garchomp

abilities.name: Avenging Aura
abilities.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this Pokémon's attacks do 80 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Over Slice
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It flies at the speed of sound while searching for prey, and it has midair battles with Salamence as the two compete for food.

data.name: Murkrow
data.flavorText: It has a weakness for shiny things. It's been known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.

data.name: Magcargo

attacks.name: Stomp Off
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its brittle shell occasionally spouts intense flames that circulate throughout its body.

data.name: Alolan Rattata
data.flavorText: When the sun goes down, it becomes active. It runs around town on a chase for good food for the boss of its nest—Raticate.

data.name: Carracosta

abilities.name: Ancient Custom
abilities.text: Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Pokémon have no effect.

attacks.name: Aqua Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: Its jaws are terrifyingly powerful. It could eat Omastar and Omanyte whole and not be bothered in the slightest by their shells.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

data.name: Alolan Grimer

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The crystals on Grimer's body are lumps of toxins. If one falls off, lethal poisons leak out.

data.name: Trapinch

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Its jaws are strong enough to crush rocks but so heavy that it can't get up if it flips over. Sandile seize those moments as their chance.

data.name: Salandit
data.flavorText: The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can't evolve.

data.name: Metapod

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Its shell is filled with its soft innards. It doesn't move much because of the risk it might carelessly spill its innards out.

data.name: Lucario & Melmetal-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Steel Fist
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metal Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Full Metal Wall-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your Metal Pokémon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard all Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Muk & Alolan Muk-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 8 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Poison Absorption
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, heal 100 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nasty Goo Mix-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. If this Pokémon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), put 15 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Chandelure

attacks.name: Spirit Burner
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. This attack does 60 more damage for each Pokémon you discarded in this way. Then, put any number of Fire Pokémon you discarded in this way onto your Bench.

data.flavorText: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.

data.name: Azurill

abilities.name: Growing Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that lives by water. It moves quickly on land by bouncing on its big tail.

data.name: Dragonite-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sky Judgment
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mach Delivery-GX
attacks.text: You may discard any number of cards from your hand until you have 9 or fewer. Draw cards until you have 10 cards in your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas inhabited by Magneton, which send out mysterious electrical signals.

data.name: Alolan Persian-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Smug Face
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's TAG TEAM Pokémon and Ultra Beasts, and by your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy attached to them.

attacks.name: Stalking Claws-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Gardevoir & Sylveon-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fairy Song
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fairy Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Kaleidostorm
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Magical Miracle-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fairy Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Slowpoke & Psyduck-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ditch and Splash
attacks.text: Discard any number of Supporter cards from your hand. This attack does 40 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Thrilling Times-GX
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 100 more damage. If this Pokémon has at least 6 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), flip 10 coins instead, and this attack does 100 more damage for each heads. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Diglett

abilities.name: Underground Work
abilities.text: If you discard this Pokémon with the effect of Giovanni's Exile, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: It travels through tunnels that it digs underground. It hates sunlight, so it comes out only after the sun goes down.

data.name: Karate Belt
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, the attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to cost Fighting less.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tauros-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mad Bull-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Kyogre

attacks.name: High Water
attacks.text: Attach 2 Water Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swirling Waves
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A mythical Pokémon said to have swelled the seas with rain and tidal waves. It battled with Groudon.

data.name: Flygon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dusty Defense
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, all of your Pokémon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Desert Hurricane
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 120 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge-GX
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Fomantis

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When the sun rises, Fomantis spreads its four leaves and bathes in the sunlight. The tip of its head has a pleasant aroma.

data.name: Surprise Box
rules: Put a card from your opponent's discard pile into their hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Misty's Favor
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Supporter cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lillie's Full Force
rules: Draw 4 cards.
At the end of this turn, if you have 3 or more cards in your hand, shuffle cards from your hand into your deck until you have 2 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Starmie-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Star Stream
attacks.text: Attach 2 Water Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lillipup

attacks.name: Baby-Doll Eyes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon has excellent judgment. If it decides it can't defeat an opponent, it immediately turns tail and vamooses.

data.name: Erika's Hospitality
rules: You can play this card only if you have 4 or fewer other cards in your hand.
Draw a card for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Frogadier

attacks.name: Afterimage Strike
attacks.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

data.flavorText: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

data.name: Sunkern

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It may plummet from the sky. If attacked by a Spearow, it will violently shake its leaves.

data.name: Doduo

attacks.name: Double Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.

data.name: Wailmer
data.flavorText: It swims along with its mouth open and swallows down seawater along with its food. It sprays excess water out of its nostrils.

data.name: Koga's Trap
rules: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lurantis-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flower Supply
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Solar Blade
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chloroscythe-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Litten
data.flavorText: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.

data.name: Bounsweet
data.flavorText: Because of its sweet, delicious aroma, bird Pokémon are always after it, but it's not intelligent enough to care.

data.name: Alolan Vulpix

abilities.name: Snowed In
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

data.flavorText: If you carelessly approach it because it's cute, the boss of the pack, Ninetales, will appear and freeze you.

data.name: Venomoth-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shinobi Mastery
attacks.text: If you played Koga's Trap from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage. If you played Janine from your hand during this turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Ten-Card Return-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Tynamo

attacks.name: Wild River
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

data.name: Incineroar-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hustling Strike
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your Benched Fire Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tiger Swing
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Burning Slam-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Bewear

attacks.name: Bear Hug
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Superpower
attacks.text: You may do 40 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.

data.name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Although it has become capable of living on land, it spends its time in the water, where its prey, fish Pokémon, are plentiful.

data.name: Larvesta
data.flavorText: When battling opponents, it sprays fire from its five horns. The max temperature of the flames can reach nearly 5,500 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Joltik

attacks.name: Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.

data.name: Whimsicott-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fluffy Cotton
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

attacks.name: Energy Blow
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Toy Box-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Professor Oak's Setup
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon of different types and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Team Skull Grunt
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard 2 Energy cards from it.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Carvanha
data.flavorText: They're such cowards that they won't hunt alone. When five or so of them get together, they suddenly turn ferocious!

data.name: Geodude

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Geodude that have lived a long life have had all their edges smoothed out until they're totally round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.

data.name: Weezing

abilities.name: Detention Gas
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Basic Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Splattering Sludge
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.

data.name: Salandit
data.flavorText: The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can't evolve.

data.name: Archeops

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This ancient Pokémon's plumage is delicate, so if anyone other than an experienced professional tries to restore it, they will fail.

data.name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It marches over the land in search of bug Pokémon to eat. Then it takes them underwater so it can dine on them where it's safe.

data.name: Sandshrew

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: It lives in areas of limited rainfall. When danger approaches, it curls up into a ball to protect its soft stomach.

data.name: Heracross

attacks.name: Turn the Tables
attacks.text: If 1 of your opponent's Pokémon used a GX attack during their last turn, your opponent shuffles their Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck.

data.flavorText: It's proud of its thick horn. In Alola, its biggest rival is Vikavolt, which it's always fighting with.

data.name: Beastite
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The attacks of the Ultra Beast this card is attached to do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon for each Prize card you have taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Sandygast

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.flavorText: It likes the shovel on its head, so Sandygast will get serious and fight any children who come to take it back.

data.name: Karate Belt
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, the attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to cost Fighting less.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Poké Maniac
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon that have a Retreat Cost of exactly 4, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Salandit

attacks.name: Grass Fire
attacks.text: Discard a Grass Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can't evolve.

data.name: Farfetch'd
data.flavorText: The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.

data.name: Misty's Water Command
rules: Move any number of Water Energy from your Pokémon to your Psyduck, Horsea, Staryu, Starmie-GX, Magikarp, Gyarados, or Lapras in any way you like.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ilima
rules: Each player shuffles their hand into their deck and flips a coin. If heads, that player draws 6 cards. If tails, they draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Confusion Wave
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

data.flavorText: As a result of headaches so fierce they cause it to cry, it sometimes uses psychokinesis without meaning to.

data.name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: They're popular, but they're rare. Trainers who show them off recklessly may be targeted by thieves.

data.name: Alolan Sandshrew

attacks.name: Run Around
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: After fleeing a volcanic eruption, it ended up moving to an area of snowy mountains. Its ice shell is as hard as steel.

data.name: Natu

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of either player's deck and put them back in any order.

data.flavorText: Although it still can't fly, its jumping power is outstanding. It jumps way up into trees and plucks the buds from the branches.

data.name: Wimpod

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.flavorText: It will pick up anything it finds on the ground. Sometimes it finds coins, so Murkrow and Meowth will go after it.

data.name: Flyinium Z: Air Slash
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to has the Air Slash attack, it can use the GX attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Speeding Skystrike-GX
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Hoothoot

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Every day, it tilts its head in the same rhythm. A long time ago, people raised these Pokémon to serve as clocks.

data.name: Raichu-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spark Ball-GX
attacks.text: (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lunala-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Psychic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Moongeist Beam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't be healed during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lunar Fall-GX
attacks.text: Knock Out 1 of your opponent's Basic Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Marshadow & Machamp-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Acme of Heroism-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), and if it would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their next turn, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Giovanni's Exile
rules: Discard up to 2 of your Benched Pokémon that have no damage counters on them and all cards attached to them.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Morelull

attacks.name: Flickering Spores
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.

data.name: Energy Spinner
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you go second and it's your first turn, search for up to 3 basic Energy cards instead of 1. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Camerupt

attacks.name: Strong Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The volcanoes on its back have a major eruption every 10 years—or whenever it becomes really angry.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Growlithe

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It's both clever and loyal, but if a stranger tries to invade its territory, it barks threateningly.

data.name: Magmortar

attacks.name: Smoke Bomb
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: There are still quite a few factories that rely on the flames provided by Magmortar to process metals.

data.name: Silvally-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Disk Reload
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Brave Buddies
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Silver Knight-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Ultra Beast, it is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Ninetales

attacks.name: Rubbish Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each Pokémon Tool card in your discard pile.

data.flavorText: The reason it guides people all the way down to the mountain's base is that it wants them to hurry up and leave.

data.name: Liepard

attacks.name: Shadow Scratch
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.

data.name: Lillie's Poké Doll
rules: Play this card as if it were a 30-HP Colorless Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may discard all cards from it and put it on the bottom of your deck.
This card can't retreat. If this card is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Dwebble
data.flavorText: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.

data.name: Mega Lopunny & Jigglypuff-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jumping Balloon
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play.

attacks.name: Puffy Smashers-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. If this Pokémon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 200 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Meowth

attacks.name: Swagger
