attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's impulsive, selfish, and fickle. It's very popular with some Trainers who like giving it the attention it needs.

data.name: Bug Catcher
rules: Draw 2 cards. Flip a coin. If heads, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Meal Time
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, draw a card.

data.flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

data.name: Naganadel & Guzzlord-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Violent Appetite
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Pokémon from your hand. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chaotic Order-GX
attacks.text: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.) If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Psychic Energy and 1 extra Darkness Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 2 Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Stoutland

abilities.name: Arf Arf Bark
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It pays no mind to the cold, thanks to its long warm coat. Stoutland in Alola look a little uncomfortable.

data.name: Dragonite

abilities.name: Hurricane Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card, a Lightning Energy card, or 1 of each from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Dragon Impact
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It flies over raging seas as if they were nothing. Observing this, a ship's captain dubbed this Pokémon "the sea incarnate."

data.name: Alolan Muk

attacks.name: Panic Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: There are over a hundred kinds of poison inside its body. Chemical reactions between different poisons are the source of its vitality.

data.name: Pelipper

attacks.name: Courier
attacks.text: Put 1 of your Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Gathering food is the work of young males. They store food in their capacious beaks and carry it back to others waiting in the nest.

data.name: Psyduck
data.flavorText: Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it normally passes the time spacing out and doing as little as possible.

data.name: Decidueye

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Brave Bird
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.

data.name: Noctowl

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: With eyes that can see in pitch-darkness, it never lets its prey escape. Some even call it "the emperor of dark nights."

data.name: Snubbull

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its growls make its opponents uneasy. This laid-back Pokémon tends to sleep half the day.

data.name: Honchkrow-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ruler of the Night
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Pokémon Tool, Special Energy, or Stadium cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Feather Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Unfair-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard 2 cards from it. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pheromosa & Buzzwole-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jet Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Elegant Sole
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Elegant Sole attack's base damage is 60.

attacks.name: Beast Game-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card. If this Pokémon has at least 7 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 3 more Prize cards instead. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Brock's Pewter City Gym
rules: Onix-GX (both yours and your opponent's) take 40 less damage from the opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Whimsicott

attacks.name: Sneaky Pocket
attacks.text: Put a card from your hand in the Lost Zone. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Lost March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon, except p (Prism Star) Pokémon, in the Lost Zone.

data.flavorText: This nuisance sneaks into people's homes, where it hides important things and scatters cotton all over the place.

data.name: Togedemaru

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: When it's surprised or agitated, the 14 fur spikes on its back will stand up involuntarily.

data.name: Kyurem

attacks.name: Call Forth Cold
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Hail Prison
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

data.name: Sylveon

attacks.name: Moonblast
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Beloved Pulse
attacks.text: If you played a TAG TEAM Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: Once a fight breaks out, it will unflinchingly charge at dragon Pokémon that are many times larger than itself.

data.name: Giant Hearth
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a card from their hand. If they do, that player searches their deck for up to 2 Fire Energy cards, reveals them, and puts them into their hand. Then, that player shuffles their deck.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Krokorok

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Krokorok really hates it when its body gets cold. On nights when the temperature drops, it digs deep into the desert sands.

data.name: Mismagius

abilities.name: Mysterious Message
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand. If you drew any cards in this way, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Feared for its wrath and the curses it spreads, this Pokémon will also, on a whim, cast spells that help people.

data.name: Axew

abilities.name: Unnerve
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent plays an Item or Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.

data.name: Snorunt
data.flavorText: It feeds mainly on ice and snow. It's only able to survive in a limited number of places in the warm Alola region.

data.name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Mirror Shot
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.flavorText: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.

data.name: Oranguru

abilities.name: Instruct
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

data.name: Duskull

abilities.name: Spiritborne Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 3 cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Ominous Eyes
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.

data.name: Rowlet & Alolan Exeggutor-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Super Growth
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Grass Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. If that Pokémon is now a Stage 1 Pokémon, search your deck for a Stage 2 Pokémon that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Calming Hurricane
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tropical Hour-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles all Energy from all of their Pokémon into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Normalium Z: Tackle
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to has the Tackle attack, it can use the GX attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Barreling Blitz-GX
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Clefairy
data.flavorText: They're popular, but they're rare. Trainers who show them off recklessly may be targeted by thieves.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: While it's quite friendly toward humans once it's grown used to them, in the wild it must be quite fierce to defend its territory from Rockruff.

data.name: Lillie's Poké Doll
rules: Play this card as if it were a 30-HP Colorless Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may discard all cards from it and put it on the bottom of your deck.
This card can't retreat. If this card is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tag Switch
rules: Move up to 2 Energy from 1 of your TAG TEAM Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Walrein

attacks.name: Cold Snap
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from their hand during their next turn. If 1 of your Pokémon used Cold Snap during your last turn, this attack can't be used.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.

data.name: Cherish Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon-GX, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tangrowth

attacks.name: Grass Knot
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

data.name: Thundurus

attacks.name: Thunderous Gale
attacks.text: If Tornadus is on your Bench, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

data.name: Gabite
data.flavorText: It loves shiny things. When it finds a Sableye trying to catch a Carbink, Gabite becomes furiously angry and attacks the Sableye.

data.name: Repel
rules: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tropius

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Leaf Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The bunches of fruit growing around the necks of Tropius in Alola are especially sweet compared to those in other regions.

data.name: Onix

attacks.name: Bedrock Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.

data.name: Yanmega

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes' heads instantly while flying by at high speed.

data.name: Makuhita

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It was originally brought in from another region, but now Makuhita from Alola are more famous.

data.name: Litten

attacks.name: Caturday
attacks.text: Draw a card. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

data.name: Rowlet & Alolan Exeggutor-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Super Growth
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Grass Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. If that Pokémon is now a Stage 1 Pokémon, search your deck for a Stage 2 Pokémon that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Calming Hurricane
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tropical Hour-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles all Energy from all of their Pokémon into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Great Catcher
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX with their Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Cleffa

abilities.name: Excitable Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, shuffle your hand into your deck and then draw 6 cards. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.flavorText: On nights with many shooting stars, they gather in packs and dance in circles. If you should see them, something good will happen!

data.name: Metal Core Barrier
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your opponent's turn.
The Metal Pokémon this card is attached to takes 70 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Misdreavus

attacks.name: Ominous Eyes
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: What gives meaning to its life is surprising others. If you set your ear against the red orbs around its neck, you can hear shrieking.

data.name: Wartortle

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: When tapped, this Pokémon will pull in its head, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.

data.name: Sabrina's Suggestion
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand. You may choose a Supporter card you find there and use the effect of that card as the effect of this card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Charjabug

abilities.name: Battery
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Vikavolt or Vikavolt-GX as a Special Energy card. This card provides 2 Lightning Energy only while it's attached to a Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It buries itself in fallen leaves and barely moves, munching away on humus. If you accidentally step on one, you'll get a shock!

data.name: Jolteon

abilities.name: Speed Cheer
abilities.text: The attacks of your Pokémon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee cost Colorless less. You can't apply more than 1 Speed Cheer Ability at a time.

data.flavorText: Its lungs contain an organ that creates electricity. The crackling sound of electricity can be heard when it exhales.

data.name: Yungoos
data.flavorText: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.

data.name: Lunala-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Psychic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Moongeist Beam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't be healed during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lunar Fall-GX
attacks.text: Knock Out 1 of your opponent's Basic Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Bellsprout
data.flavorText: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.

data.name: Primarina-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bubble Beat
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Roaring Seas
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grand Echo-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Marshadow

attacks.name: Shadow Imitation
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's non-GX attacks and use it as this attack.

data.flavorText: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it's imitating.

data.name: Poliwrath

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Wake-Up Slap
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 80 more damage. Then, remove all Special Conditions from that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its body is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy and forces its swimming prowess to develop.

data.name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Hurricane Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Kangaskhan's maternal love is so deep that it will brave death to protect its offspring.

data.name: Martial Arts Dojo
rules: The attacks of non-Ultra Beast Pokémon that have any basic Fighting Energy attached to them (both yours and your opponent's) do 10 more damage to the opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If the attacking player has more Prize cards remaining than their opponent, those attacks do 40 more damage instead.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Naganadel & Guzzlord-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Violent Appetite
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Pokémon from your hand. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chaotic Order-GX
attacks.text: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.) If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Psychic Energy and 1 extra Darkness Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 2 Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Bisharp

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

data.flavorText: No matter how strong the Bisharp, it's said that if the blade on its head is chipped, it will retire from its position as the boss.

data.name: Crabrawler
data.flavorText: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.

data.name: Lampent

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

data.name: Venomoth-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shinobi Mastery
attacks.text: If you played Koga's Trap from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage. If you played Janine from your hand during this turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Ten-Card Return-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Red's Challenge
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Crobat

abilities.name: Sound Veil
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.flavorText: Its fangs are so sharp, if it bites you in the dark and sucks your blood, you won't notice any pain or realize you've been bitten.

data.name: Vigoroth

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its heartbeat is fast and its blood so agitated that it can't sit still for one second.

data.name: Marshadow

abilities.name: Resetting Hole
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may discard any Stadium card in play. If you do, discard this Pokémon and all cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Red Knuckles
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Ultra Beast, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it's imitating.

data.name: Murkrow

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.flavorText: It has a weakness for shiny things. It's been known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.

data.name: Naganadel-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Conversion
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard an Ultra Beast card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Venom Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Injection-GX
attacks.text: Add a card from your opponent's discard pile to their Prize cards face down. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Rattata
data.flavorText: Its incisors grow continuously throughout its life. If its incisors get too long, this Pokémon becomes unable to eat, and it starves to death.

data.name: Nest Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Terrakion

attacks.name: Cavern Counter
attacks.text: If all of your Benched Pokémon have at least 1 damage counter on them, this attack does 150 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.

data.name: Fomantis

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Never Give Up
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you have at least 3 more Prize cards remaining than your opponent. Attach all Lightning Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: As electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes more aggressive. One theory is that the electricity buildup is actually causing stress.

data.name: Keldeo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Pure Heart
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Resolute Blade-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Sneasel
data.flavorText: They will cooperate to steal eggs from the nests of bird Pokémon, but fights break out to determine which one gets to eat the eggs.

data.name: Reshiram & Zekrom-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fabled Flarebolts
attacks.text: Discard up to 3 in any combination of basic Fire and basic Lightning Energy cards from your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Cross Break-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If you played N's Resolve from your hand during this turn, this attack also does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's other Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Dodrio

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Accelerating Stab
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Accelerating Stab during your next turn.

data.flavorText: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads—even for a second—will get pecked severely.

data.name: Island Challenge Amulet
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX this card is attached to gets -100 HP, and when it is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, that player takes 1 fewer Prize card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Scrafty

attacks.name: Turf Raid
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your remaining Prize cards.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon may be rude, but it takes very good care of its family, its friends, and its turf.

attacks.name: Follow My Tail
attacks.text: Search your deck for any number of Eevee and Eevee-GX and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: The question of why only Eevee has such unstable genes has still not been solved.

data.name: Reset Stamp
rules: Your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck and draws a card for each of their remaining Prize cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.flavorText: It climbs up cliffs as it heads toward the peak of a mountain. As soon as it reaches the summit, it rolls back down the way it came.

data.name: Teddiursa
data.flavorText: If it finds honey, its crescent mark glows. It always licks its paws because they are soaked with honey.

data.name: Island Challenge Amulet
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

attacks.name: Blazer

attacks.name: Fireball Circus
attacks.text: Discard any number of Fire Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

data.name: Blue's Tactics
rules: At the end of this turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Talonflame

attacks.name: Heat Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flare Raid
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its tough wings don't allow fire to pass through them. A long time ago, firefighters' outfits were made from Talonflame wings.

data.name: Dusknoir

abilities.name: Grim Marking
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Psych Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Psych Up attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.

data.name: Dedenne-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dedechange
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dedechange Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Tingly Return-GX

data.name: Rosa
rules: You can play this card only if 1 of your Pokémon was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.
Search your deck for a Pokémon, a Trainer card, and a basic Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Sawsbuck

abilities.name: Seasonal Blessings
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck's horns.

data.name: Weepinbell

attacks.name: Burning Venom
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.

data.name: Bellelba & Brycen-Man
rules: Discard 3 cards from the top of each player's deck.
When you play this card, you may discard 3 other cards from your hand. If you do, each player discards their Benched Pokémon until they have 3 Benched Pokémon. Your opponent discards first.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Misty's Favor
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Supporter cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Cynthia & Caitlin
rules: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand. You can't choose Cynthia & Caitlin or a card you discarded with the effect of this card.
When you play this card, you may discard another card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Its claws and horns often break off. The broken claws and horns can be used to carve plows for tilling farm fields.

data.name: Scraggy

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They move in small groups, walking around lazily. Anyone who makes eye contact gets smacked with a headbutt.

data.name: Wooper
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Lightning Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: As electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes more aggressive. One theory is that the electricity buildup is actually causing stress.

data.name: Krokorok

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: They move in groups of a few individuals. A female is often the leader of the group, and the males will gather food.

data.name: Gardevoir & Sylveon-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.
