attacks.name: Rock Artillery
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Fighting Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: Known for its hefty horsepower, this Pokémon is a popular partner for construction workers.

data.name: Rhydon

attacks.name: Dirty Work
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck. If you played Giovanni's Exile from your hand during this turn, discard the top 5 cards instead.

data.flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Pyukumuku

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: The tradition known as Pyukumuku chucking started from the custom of throwing Pyukumuku back into the sea after they wash onshore.

data.name: Raichu & Alolan Raichu-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tandem Shock
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 80 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lightning Ride-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 100 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Tauros-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mad Bull-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Erika
rules: Each player may draw up to 3 cards. You draw first.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Togepi

attacks.name: Daunt
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.

data.name: Gumshoos-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Search the Premises
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent reveal their hand.

attacks.name: Gumshoe Chance-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Volt Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

data.name: Dragonite

attacks.name: Dragon Wave
attacks.text: Discard a Grass Energy and a Lightning Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giant Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Incur the wrath of this normally calm Pokémon at your peril, because it will smash everything to smithereens before it's satisfied.

data.name: Pokégear 3.0
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Supporter card you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Vaporeon

abilities.name: Vitality Cheer
abilities.text: Your Pokémon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee get +60 HP. You can't apply more than 1 Vitality Cheer Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Refreshing Rain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Clean, clear waters are its usual habitat. When it's about to be attacked by an invading enemy, it dives into the water to hide.

data.name: Dartrix

attacks.name: Wing Flick
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don't groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.

data.name: Cosmog

attacks.name: Dust Gathering
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.

data.name: Red & Blue
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon-GX that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.)
When you play this card, you may discard 2 other cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to the Pokémon you evolved in this way.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Great Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Victini

attacks.name: Victory Sign
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards of different types and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

data.name: Double Colorless Energy
rules: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

data.name: Granbull

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Fight Back
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: More timid than Snubbull, this Pokémon is doted on by young people amused at the contrast between its looks and its attitude.

data.name: Gengar

abilities.name: Shadow Pain
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 6 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in any way you like.

attacks.name: Twilight Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: You can hear tales told all over the world about how Gengar will pay a visit to children who are naughty.

data.name: Garchomp & Giratina-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Calamitous Slash
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: GG End-GX
attacks.text: Discard 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and all cards attached to it. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fighting Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard 2 of your opponent's Pokémon instead. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Surskit

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: When this Pokémon senses danger, a sweet fluid oozes from the tip of its heads. The taste of it disgusts bird Pokémon.

data.name: Persian-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Cat Walk
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if 1 of your Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. You can't use more than 1 Cat Walk Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile. You can't add more than 180 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Slash Back-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Squirtle

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

data.name: Roller Skater
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards. If you discarded an Energy card in this way, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pheromosa & Buzzwole-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jet Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Elegant Sole
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Elegant Sole attack's base damage is 60.

attacks.name: Beast Game-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card. If this Pokémon has at least 7 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 3 more Prize cards instead. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Golbat

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Its thick fangs are hollow like straws, making them unexpectedly fragile. These fangs are specialized for sucking blood.

data.name: Weezing

abilities.name: Blow-Away Bomb
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you discard this Pokémon with the effect of Roxie, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Place damage counters after the effect of Roxie.)

attacks.name: Balloon Burst
attacks.text: Discard this Pokémon and all cards attached to it.

data.flavorText: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.

data.name: Honchkrow-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ruler of the Night
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Pokémon Tool, Special Energy, or Stadium cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Feather Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Unfair-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard 2 cards from it. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Weavile-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shadow Connection
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Darkness Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nocturnal Maneuvers-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for any number of Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Popplio
data.flavorText: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It's famous for being a hard worker.

data.name: Golem

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their shells. Those that have lived a long, long time have shells green with moss.

data.name: Grubbin

attacks.name: Electrical Signal
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: If you find its nest, you shouldn't stick your hand inside. You'll get bitten by an irritated Grubbin.

data.name: Volcarona-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Flaming Shot
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Backfire
attacks.text: Put 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

attacks.name: Massive Heat Wave-GX
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pangoro
data.flavorText: This rowdy Pokémon boasts great physical strength. Many Trainers are also smitten by its lively character.

data.name: Spinda

attacks.name: Teeter Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Its steps are staggering and unsteady, but Spinda thinks it's walking in a straight line.

data.name: Lucario

abilities.name: Tag Coach
abilities.text: Your TAG TEAM Pokémon take 20 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It concentrates its mental energy and fires off mysterious waves called auras, which can crush boulders of large size to dust.

data.name: Hoopa

attacks.name: Evil Admonition
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon that has an Ability.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.

data.name: Parasect

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 60 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 120 damage.

attacks.name: Mushroom Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The large mushroom on its back controls it. It often fights over territory with Shiinotic.

data.name: Vibrava

abilities.name: Obnoxious Whirring
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It vibrates its wings to generate ultrasonic waves, causing its prey to faint. Then it buries the prey alive in the sand to preserve it.

data.name: Lana's Fishing Rod
rules: Shuffle a Pokémon and a Pokémon Tool card from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Onix-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Rocky Avalanche-GX
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pidove
data.flavorText: This very forgetful Pokémon will wait for a new order from its Trainer even though it already has one.

data.name: Naganadel & Guzzlord-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Violent Appetite
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Pokémon from your hand. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chaotic Order-GX
attacks.text: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.) If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Psychic Energy and 1 extra Darkness Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 2 Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Whimsicott

abilities.name: Prowl
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: This nuisance sneaks into people's homes, where it hides important things and scatters cotton all over the place.

data.name: Amoonguss

abilities.name: Bursting Spores
abilities.text: Whenever you play a Pokémon that has the Spore attack from your hand during your turn, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

data.name: Fire Crystal
rules: Put 3 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tangela

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

data.name: N's Resolve
rules: Discard the top 6 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are basic Energy cards, attach them to 1 of your Benched Dragon Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pinsir-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Guillotine-GX
attacks.text: (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Dhelmise

attacks.name: Sea Creeper Net
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It wraps its prey in green seaweed and sucks away their vitality. It only likes to go after big prey like Wailord.

data.name: Weezing

abilities.name: Surrender Now
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is discarded with the effect of Jessie & James, you may have your opponent discard a card from their hand. (They discard that card after the effect of Jessie & James.)

data.flavorText: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.

data.name: Dragonite-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sky Judgment
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mach Delivery-GX
attacks.text: You may discard any number of cards from your hand until you have 9 or fewer. Draw cards until you have 10 cards in your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ultimate Ray
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Altered Creation-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), when your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from those attacks, take 1 more Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Darmanitan

attacks.name: Find Wildfire
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Fire Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.

data.name: Litten

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

data.name: Latios-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Power Bind
abilities.text: If you have 4 or fewer Pokémon in play, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Tag Purge
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from TAG TEAM Pokémon.

attacks.name: Clear Vision-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your opponent can't use any GX attacks. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Smoke Bomb
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.flavorText: Its entire body is burning. When it breathes, the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames shoot out!

data.name: Kommo-o

attacks.name: Shout of Power
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scaly Uppercut
attacks.text: You may discard a Pokémon Tool card from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: When it howls after finishing off its prey, the metallic sounds of its celebrating comrades can be heard from all around.

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Bubble Hold
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It doesn't like to be taken care of. It's difficult to bond with since it won't listen to its Trainer.

data.name: Wigglytuff

attacks.name: Orb Polish
attacks.text: Put 3 Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Sleepy Ball
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Thanks to its bouncy body and fine fur, this Pokémon is sought after. Holding one in your arms while you sleep feels great.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.

data.name: Torkoal

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Coal is the source of Torkoal's energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mounts where they live.

data.name: Trapinch

attacks.name: Nest Building
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Its jaws are strong enough to crush rocks but so heavy that it can't get up if it flips over. Sandile seize those moments as their chance.

data.name: Tsareena

abilities.name: Queenly Majesty
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may have your opponent reveal their hand. Then, discard a card from it.

attacks.name: Trop Kick
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage and remove all Special Conditions from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its long, striking legs aren't just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.

data.name: Masquerain

attacks.name: Struggle Bug
attacks.text: Move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its wings and antennae don't cope well with moisture. After a rain, it faces sunward to dry off.

data.name: Cosmoem

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 40 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it the "cocoon of the stars" and built an altar to worship it.

data.name: Roxie
rules: Discard up to 2 Pokémon that aren't Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX from your hand. Draw 3 cards for each card you discarded in this way.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Bibarel

abilities.name: Unaware
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.

data.name: Sewaddle

abilities.name: Swaddling Leaves
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

data.name: Solgaleo & Lunala-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cosmic Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Cosmic Burn during your next turn.

attacks.name: Light of the Protector-GX
attacks.text: If you played Lillie's Full Force from your hand during this turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to each of your Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Tangela

attacks.name: Tangle Drag
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

data.name: Passimian

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.flavorText: They use their saliva to stick leaves to their shoulders. You can tell what troop they belong to from the position of the leaves.

data.name: Solgaleo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sunsteel Strike
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sol Burst-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Dedenne-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dedechange
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dedechange Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Tingly Return-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. Put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ultimate Ray
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Altered Creation-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), when your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from those attacks, take 1 more Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Chansey

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It seems that other Pokémon's efforts to take its delicious, nutritious egg away from it caused Chansey to get faster at fleeing.

data.name: Relicanth

attacks.name: Deep Sea Boring
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Thought to have gone extinct, Relicanth was given a name that is a variation of the name of the person who discovered it.

data.name: Devolution Spray Z
rules: Devolve 1 of your evolved Pokémon by shuffling any number of Evolution cards on it into your deck. (That Pokémon can't evolve this turn.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Dewgong

attacks.name: Dual Blizzard
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight knots, searching for Pokémon that will become its prey. It's especially fond of Wishiwashi.

data.name: Muk & Alolan Muk-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 8 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Poison Absorption
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, heal 100 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nasty Goo Mix-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. If this Pokémon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), put 15 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Spritzee

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.

data.name: Pignite
data.flavorText: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.

data.name: Stoutland

attacks.name: Ferocious Bellow
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 50 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Intelligent, good-natured, and valiant, it's a trustworthy partner on rescue teams.

data.name: Haunter

attacks.name: Sinister Fog
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: On moonless nights, Haunter searches for someone to curse, so it's best not to go out walking around.

data.name: Staryu

attacks.name: Numbing Water
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: In many places, there are folktales of stardust falling into the ocean and becoming Staryu.

data.name: Toxapex

abilities.name: Toxic Spikes
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's Active Pokémon retreats, their new Active Pokémon is Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.

data.name: Honedge

attacks.name: Lucky Find
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Item card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.

data.name: Team Skull Grunt
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard 2 Energy cards from it.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Landorus

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as "The Guardian of the Fields."

data.name: Tsareena

abilities.name: Queenly Reward
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Grass Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A master of grand and beautiful kicks, it can knock out even kickboxing champions with a single blow.

data.name: Cosmog

abilities.name: Unaware
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.

data.name: Rowlet
data.flavorText: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.

data.name: Decidueye

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tracking Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at opponents. When it simply can't afford to miss, it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.

data.name: Electromagnetic Radar
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Lightning Pokémon-GX and Lightning Pokémon-EX, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Whimsicott-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fluffy Cotton
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

attacks.name: Energy Blow
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Toy Box-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lanturn

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Aqua Spark
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

data.name: Wishiwashi

abilities.name: Scatter
abilities.text: At the end of your opponent's turn, if this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, flip a coin. If tails, shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

data.flavorText: Wishiwashi assemble in this formation to face off against strong foes. It boasts a strength that earned it the name "demon of the sea."

data.name: Lurantis-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flower Supply
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Solar Blade
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chloroscythe-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Doublade

attacks.name: Slashing Cutter
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.

data.name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Confusion Wave
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

data.flavorText: Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it normally passes the time spacing out and doing as little as possible.

data.name: Fire Crystal
rules: Put 3 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Hitmontop

attacks.name: Finishing Combo
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if your Hitmonlee used Special Combo during your last turn. This attack does 60 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It fights while spinning like a top. The centrifugal force boosts its destructive power by 10.

data.name: Rotom Dex
rules: After counting your Prize cards, shuffle them into your deck. Then, take that many cards from the top of your deck and put them face down as your Prize cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Braviary

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Aero Fall
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The more scars it has on its front, the more heroic it's considered to be. Those with many scars on their back are mocked by the flock.

data.name: Mallow & Lana
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
When you play this card, you may discard 2 other cards from your hand. If you do, heal 120 damage from the Pokémon you moved to your Bench.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Triple Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Its wings are covered in toxic scales. If it finds bird Pokémon going after Caterpie, Butterfree sprinkles its scales on them to drive them off.

data.name: Haxorus

abilities.name: Grind Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard any Stadium card in play. If you do, attach up to 3 in any combination of Fire and Metal Energy cards from your hand to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Powerful Axe
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage times the amount of basic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.

data.name: Araquanid

attacks.name: Tangle Drag
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sticky Web
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more, and its Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

data.flavorText: It usually passes its time in the water. When its belly is full, it stores its subdued prey in the water bubble on its head.

data.name: Koga's Trap
rules: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Basculin

attacks.name: Swarming Bites
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Basculin you have in play to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Savage, violent Pokémon, red and blue Basculin are always fighting each other over territory.

data.name: Spheal

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: They can't swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they're happy, they clap fins.

data.name: Whimsicott-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fluffy Cotton
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

attacks.name: Energy Blow
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Toy Box-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Primarina

attacks.name: Disarming Voice
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sparkling Aria
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learning from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.

data.name: Salazzle
data.flavorText: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.

data.name: Lillipup

attacks.name: Work Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Because it doesn't yelp, it's extremely popular with Trainers who live in apartment buildings.

data.name: Murkrow

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.flavorText: It has a weakness for shiny things. It's been known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.

data.name: Wishiwashi

abilities.name: Cowardice
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard all cards attached to this Pokémon and return it to your hand. You can't use this Ability during your first turn or on the turn this Pokémon was put into play.

data.flavorText: When it's in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.

data.name: Florges

abilities.name: Flower Picking
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may choose 2 random cards from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into their deck.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It controls the flowers it grows. The petal blizzards that Florges triggers are overwhelming in their beauty and power.

data.name: Cherish Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon-GX, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: It doesn't do anything other than eat and sleep. When prompted to make a serious effort, though, it apparently displays awesome power.

data.name: Marshadow & Machamp-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Acme of Heroism-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), and if it would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their next turn, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Persian-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Smug Face
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's TAG TEAM Pokémon and Ultra Beasts, and by your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy attached to them.

attacks.name: Stalking Claws-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lucario

attacks.name: Rush Up
attacks.text: If you attached a Pokémon Tool card from your hand to this Pokémon during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: It concentrates its mental energy and fires off mysterious waves called auras, which can crush boulders of large size to dust.

data.name: Tynamo

attacks.name: Generate Electricity
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

data.name: Lt. Surge's Strategy
rules: You can play this card only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent.
During this turn, you can play 3 Supporter cards (including this card).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Gumshoos-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Search the Premises
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent reveal their hand.

attacks.name: Gumshoe Chance-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Metapod

abilities.name: Emerge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Its shell is filled with a thick liquid. All of the cells throughout its body are being rebuilt in preparation for evolution.

data.name: Rowlet

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.

data.name: Volcarona-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Flaming Shot
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Backfire
attacks.text: Put 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

attacks.name: Massive Heat Wave-GX
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Giovanni's Exile
rules: Discard up to 2 of your Benched Pokémon that have no damage counters on them and all cards attached to them.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Mega Lopunny & Jigglypuff-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jumping Balloon
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play.

attacks.name: Puffy Smashers-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. If this Pokémon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 200 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Misty's Determination
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, look at the top 8 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Moltres & Zapdos & Articuno-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sky Legends-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Fire, Water, and Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 110 damage to 3 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Ursaring

attacks.name: Heavy Hold
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: With its ability to distinguish any aroma, it unfailingly finds all food buried deep underground.

data.name: N's Resolve
rules: Discard the top 6 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are basic Energy cards, attach them to 1 of your Benched Dragon Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Wicked Tentacles
attacks.text: Move an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of their Pokémon. If you do, put 3 damage counters on the Pokémon you moved the Energy to.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It fires off ultrasonic waves from its red orbs to weaken its prey, and then it wraps them up in its 80 tentacles.

data.name: Rowlet

attacks.name: Hide and Seek
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.

data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: Its two sharp scythes are more than just weapons. It uses them with dexterity to dress its prey before eating.

data.name: Nest Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Spheal
data.flavorText: They can't swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they're happy, they clap fins.

data.name: Tauros

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Berserker Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: They live in groups. The one with the longest, thickest, and most-scarred horns is the boss of the herd.

data.name: Espeon & Deoxys-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psychic Club
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Benched Psychic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cross Division-GX
attacks.text: Put 10 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), put 20 damage counters on them instead. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: There are some places where Slowpoke is worshiped because of a long-standing belief that whenever Slowpoke yawns, it rains.

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Passimian

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Team Play
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Benched Passimian.

data.flavorText: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.

data.name: Igglybuff

abilities.name: Sleepy Voice
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.flavorText: It's always practicing its singing because it wants to improve. Even when it's asleep, it keeps singing in its dreams!

data.name: Type: Null

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon weapon developed for a specific mission, it went berserk during an experiment, so it was cryogenically frozen.

data.name: Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ultimate Ray
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Altered Creation-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), when your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from those attacks, take 1 more Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pikipek

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.

data.name: Mega Lopunny & Jigglypuff-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jumping Balloon
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play.

attacks.name: Puffy Smashers-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. If this Pokémon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 200 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Reset Stamp
rules: Your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck and draws a card for each of their remaining Prize cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tag Switch
rules: Move up to 2 Energy from 1 of your TAG TEAM Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Skorupi

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.

data.name: Blaine's Last Stand
rules: You can play this card only when it is the last card in your hand.
Draw 2 cards for each Fire Pokémon you have in play.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Golurk

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Fist of Antiquity
attacks.text: If you have any Supporter cards in your discard pile, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Some say that ancient people invented Golurk to serve as a laborer. It follows its master's orders faithfully.

data.name: Janine
rules: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put 2 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Greninja & Zoroark-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Pulse
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Union-GX
attacks.text: Put 2 in any combination of Darkness Pokémon-GX and Darkness Pokémon-EX from your discard pile onto your Bench. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), attach 2 Energy cards from your discard pile to each Pokémon that you put onto your Bench in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Grubbin
data.flavorText: They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokémon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokémon.

data.name: Weakness Guard Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
The Pokémon this card is attached to has no Weakness.

data.name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Dragon's Wish
attacks.text: During your next turn, you may attach any number of Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: From time immemorial, it has been venerated by agricultural peoples as an entity able to control the weather.

data.name: Alolan Dugtrio

abilities.name: Tangling Hair
abilities.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

attacks.name: Dig Under
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: Its shining gold hair provides it with protection. It's reputed that keeping any of its fallen hairs will bring bad luck.

data.name: Big Malasada
rules: Heal 20 damage and remove a Special Condition from your Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Crabrawler

attacks.name: Knuckle Blast
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.

data.name: Sunflora

attacks.name: Solar Power
attacks.text: During your next turn, ignore all Energy in the attack costs of Grass Pokémon and Fire Pokémon. (This includes Pokémon that come into play on that turn.)

data.flavorText: As the hot season approaches, the petals on this Pokémon's face become more vivid and lively.

data.name: Druddigon

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Tail
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: The red skin on its face is harder than rock. In narrow caves, it squares off against its enemies and charges face-first right into them.

data.name: Recycle Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
If this card is discarded from play, put it into your hand instead of the discard pile.

data.name: Honchkrow-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ruler of the Night
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Pokémon Tool, Special Energy, or Stadium cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Feather Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Unfair-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard 2 cards from it. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Gallade

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Psychic and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.

data.name: Phantump
data.flavorText: By imitating the voice of a child, it causes people to get hopelessly lost deep in the forest. It's trying to make friends with them.

data.name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Lazy Eating
abilities.text: Between turns, heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Counter
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a TAG TEAM, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.flavorText: It doesn't do anything other than eat and sleep. When prompted to make a serious effort, though, it apparently displays awesome power.

data.name: Hariyama

attacks.name: Push Out
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is known for its fantastic strength, but as it grows older, it focuses more on training Makuhita.

data.name: Triple Acceleration Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Evolution Pokémon. If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of the turn.
This card provides ColorlessColorlessColorless Energy only while it is attached to an Evolution Pokémon.
If this card is attached to anything other than an Evolution Pokémon, discard this card.

data.name: Naganadel & Guzzlord-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Violent Appetite
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Pokémon from your hand. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chaotic Order-GX
attacks.text: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.) If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Psychic Energy and 1 extra Darkness Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 2 Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lunala

abilities.name: Blessing of the Moone
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Solgaleo in play, you may search your deck for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to your Solgaleo or Lunala in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Records of it exist in writings from long, long ago, where it was known by the name "the beast that calls the moon."

data.name: Arbok

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Heavy Choke
attacks.text: If this Pokémon used Wrap during your last turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.flavorText: The latest research has determined that there are over 20 possible arrangements of the patterns on its stomach.

data.name: Silvally-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Disk Reload
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Brave Buddies
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Silver Knight-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Ultra Beast, it is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Channeler
rules: Remove all effects of attacks on you and each of your Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Breloom

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Pre-Dawn Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.

data.name: Reshiram & Charizard-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flare Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Flare Strike during your next turn.

attacks.name: Double Blaze-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fire Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 100 more damage, and this attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
